loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
This is Alfredo, 43, a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Roma, his business partner and mother to their two children. Alfredo, together with his wife, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses and support his children’s schooling. 

Alfredo operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 Philippine Pesos (PHP) worth of cooking oil, or an egg. He earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the unit. His regular customers are members of the local community. He earns a minimum of 300 PHP in sales every day.

To help him continue his business operations, Alfredo is requesting a loan of 11,000 PHP to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products needed in his business. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Alfredo hopes his business grows into a mini-grocery store and he dreams to be able to give his children a good, high quality education through all his hard work on the business. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in his business.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
LAS EMPRENDEDORAS” grupo formado por 07 socios la mayoría D. ellas viven en puente piedra  lugar al norte D. Lima, La Sra. Roberta  se dedico al negocio D. comidas ella empezó como ayudante en el restaurante D. una amiga fue donD. aprendió a cocinar con ese conocimiento decidió abrirse paso sola busco un lugar y empezó con la venta D. comidas, sus consumidores son trabajadores D. transporte  y obreros D. construcción, por mucho tiempo le fue muy bien, con esos ingresos ayudo a su hija en sus estudios, debido su  embarazo reciente a dejado el negocio D. comidas por que requiere  mucho esfuerzo , para no dejar D. trabajar empezara otro negocio que es la venta D. golosinas para ello utilizara su préstamo para comprar caramelos, chocolates gaseosas etc., espera tener éxito para poder sacar adelante a sus  hijos que aun están pequeños y es por quienes lucha cada día.

*Roberta es la primera D. la fila está cargando su bebe.
texts.en:
The Las Emprendedoras group has seven members, the majority of whom live in Puente Piedra, to the north of Lima.

Roberta worked selling food.  She began as a helper in a friend's restaurant, where she learned to cook.  With this knowledge she decided to make her way alone.  She looked for a place and began selling food.  Her customers are transportation and construction workers.  This went well for her for a long time.  With this income she helped her daughter in her studies.

As a result of her recent pregnancy, she has left the food business because it requires a lot of effort.  So as not to stop working, she will begin another business, selling candy, for which she will use her loan to buy candy, chocolate, sodas, etc.

She hopes to be successful to be able to get ahead with her young children, for whom she struggles every day.

*Roberta is the first one in the row, holding her baby.

loans.use: to buy sweets, candy, chocolate, sodas, etc.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza, 28, lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with three children.

Eliza has a karaoke shop that provides entertainment, with customers paying 5 Philippine Pesos (PHP) per song. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to pay for the electricity of the service.

Eliza has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to pay for the electricity of her service.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Gloria works hard to support her family. She has a business selling vegetables in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a sari sari (variety) store. Gloria is borrowing 22,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell in her stall.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help to her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Uyanga

texts.en:
Uyanga, 22, sells casual clothes in the market of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She lives with her parents in a ger, the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent which is located in the ger district.

Recently, she has taken over this business from her mother, who ran the business since 1999. New businesswoman Uyanga wants to run her business successfully and to improve it day by day. She now needs monetary support amounting to 3,250,000 MNT as working capital for selling during the winter. It will influence her business profit notably, according to her business plan. The loan will be used to purchase a large amount of winter clothes from her suppliers.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of winter clothes from her suppliers.

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
Erna, 32, lives in the Philippines and is married with three children. She has a bakeshop that sells breads, cakes and pastries. Erna has had this business for eight years. She has requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy ingredients needed for the bakeshop.

Erna has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients needed for the bakeshop.

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
Juditha is 45 years old and widowed with four children.

Juditha works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell.

Juditha has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from food production.

Juditha aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
Adelfa is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 

Adelfa has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Adelfa has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Adelfa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Lolita works hard to support her family.

She has a rope-making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from rice retailing. Lolita is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy materials for her rope-making business.

Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her rope-making business.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is 33 years old and married with one child.

Miriam works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Miriam has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from E-loading.

Miriam aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a guitar-making business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy materials for her guitar-making business.

Pacita has been in this business for 30 years. Pacita earns more income from her sari-sari (variety) store.

Pacita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her guitar-making business

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 53 years old and single with two children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rebecca is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rebecca has been raising pigs for two years and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 48 years old and married with eight children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like detergent, canned goods, rice and other groceries.

Rosario has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Rosario aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like detergent, canned goods, hulled  rice and other groceries.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 52 years old and lives in Silang Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Narciso, a farmer, and a mother to their two children. Both are already working. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Nida makes a living by selling ornamental plants. She grows ornamental plants that are native to the Philippines like ylang-ylang, golden shower, dahlias and orchids. Her regular customers are local tourists, neighbours and the community. She’s been twenty-one years in this business. And she earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is applying for a loan of Php 17,000. She will be using the money to buy things needed for planting such as plastics, fertilizer, pots, seedlings, and wires. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

Nida hopes her business will continue to succeed in the coming years and dreams of traveling abroad with her family .As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can draw strength and inspiration from the word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for gardening materials and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Rosenda works hard to support her family. She has a manicure/pedicure business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her sari sari store. Rosenda is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy items for her manicure set such as nail care, polish, etc.

Rosenda has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF, and hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items for her manicure set such as nail care, polish, etc.

loans.name: Rechie

texts.en:
Rechie, a 55-year-old married mother of one, works very hard to provide for her family. Rechie has been operating a sari-sari store in the Philippines for 29 years, selling a variety of items such as canned goods, soft drinks and other groceries. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

In the future, Rechie would like to build and expand her business to ensure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more store stock to sell.

loans.name: Shatar

texts.en:
Mrs. Shatar, 48, lives with her husband and daughters in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, where she has been working as a cook in the taverna for many years. She also runs a taxi business in order to increase her income, earning over MNT 20.000 each day.

Lately, due to damage to her car, it has become too dangerous for her and her passengers to operate the service. Shatar is therefore requesting this loan to purchase the spare parts required for her taxi repair.

loans.use: to purchase  new spare parts to repair her taxi.

loans.name: Lodina

texts.en:
Lodina is married with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Lodina is 60 years old.

Lodina has souvenir business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her business.

Lodina  has been in this business for 39 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her souvenir shop.

loans.name: Shelamie

texts.en:
Shelamie is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Shelamie is making and peddling viands like "ginataang langka" (unripe jackfruit cooked in coconut milk), "atsara" (pickled unripe papaya),  & "mongo" (mung bean) soup. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy raw ingredients for making viands.

Shelamie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Shelamie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making viands.

loans.name: Caren

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Caren works hard to support her family.

She has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fish farming.  Caren is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

Caren has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store

loans.name: Anecia

texts.en:
Anecia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Anecia has been in this business for four years. She earns more income from fish vending.

Anecia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira works hard to support her family. She is married and has a candle-making business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy wax, wicks, molds and other materials.

Elvira has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy wax, wicks, molds and other materials.

loans.name: Genara

texts.en:
Genara is 47 years old and is married with seven children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur who runs a firewood-selling business in the Philippines. Genara has been in the firewood business for six years. 

Genara is requesting a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more firewood to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy firewood to sell

loans.name: Ronelin

texts.en:
Ronelin is 23 years old and is married with a child. She lives in the Philippines. For the past two years, Ronelin has run a business selling a variety of dried fish using a motorcycle with her husband as the driver. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. 

Ronelin is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to buy stocks of dried fish to sell. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy dried fish to sell

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida works hard to support her family. Adelaida is married and has a fishing and fish-vending business in the Philippines. Adelaida has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials for the maintenance of her fishing boats.

Adelaida has been in this business for 14 years now. In the future, Adelaida would like to save enough to provide financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the maintenance of her fishing boats.

loans.name: 03.10.113.thiệu Chính Thieu Hoa Group

texts.en:
Nhân is 52 years old and is married with three children. For the past ten years, she has worked farming poultry and cattle. Nhân lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province. She joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women in 2010 to improve her business. Nhân has successfully repaid two previous loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women and she is the group leader of the 03.10.113.Thiệu Chính solidarity group, which consists of three members. Nhân’s main business hardship is the lack of capital. 

Nhân is requesting a loan to purchase calves to raise and to sell in the future. She hopes to use her business profit to buy a new motorbike, to help her children find good jobs, and to maintain her business.

loans.use: to purchase calves to raise

loans.name: Tranquilina

texts.en:
Tranquilina is 47 years old and single. She lives in the Philippines. For the past four years, Tranquilina has run a shop where she sells canned goods, noodles, and beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. 

Tranquilina is requesting a 17,000 PHP loan to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 46 years old and lives in Ilayang Pulo Silang Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Ronildo, who is employed, and is the mother to their two children, both of whom are studying in college. Marilyn, together with her husband, manages their household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Marilyn makes a living by selling ornamental plants. She grows ornamental plants that are native to the Philippines such as ylang-ylang, golden shower, dahlias, and orchids. Her regular customers are tourists, neighbors, and the community. Marilyn has been in this business for ten years and earns a minimum of 700 PHP in daily sales. 

Marilyn is requesting a loan of 17,000 PHP to continue operating her business. She will buy supplies such as plastic, fertilizer, pots, seedlings, baskets, and wires. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. Marilyn hopes her business will continue to succeed in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends her group's weekly fellowship* meetings where she can draw strength and inspiration from studying the word of God. 

* All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase gardening and plant nursery supplies

loans.name: Arcele

texts.en:
Arcele is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. 

Arcele has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Arcele has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Arcele hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: COMPRA DE POLIZA Y MANTENIMIENTO DE SU CARRO

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy detergents, canned goods and beverages.

loans.name: Lizalie

texts.en:
Lizalie is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children. 

Lizalie has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Lizalie has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Lizalie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: 03.9.114.thiệu Dương Thieu Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thuận has a service business repairing phones. She is requesting a loan to purchase mobile phones to resell.

Thuận is 28 years old. She is married with one child.

Thuận is the group leader of the 03.9.114.Thiệu D. solidarity group, which consists of five members. She lives and works in the Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent. 

In 2010, Thuận joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thuận has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Thuận has been involved in this business for five years.

The main harship that Thuận faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thuận hopes to build a new house, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase mobile phones to resell.

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru: Алишер ответственный и целеустремленный молодой человек. Более 10 лет он занимается купле- продажей запчастей. За товарами он ездит сам в Ташкент и привозит хорошие высококачественные товары. Торговая точка находится в центре вещевого рынка. Кроме того он продает хозяйственные товары. Более 10лет, полученную прибыль расходует на лечение супруги. Его супруга находится в больнице города Ташкента и он хочет вылечить её и привезти домой. Он мечтает получить большую прибыль, с этой цель он запрашивает займ для расширения ассортимента товаров. Обещает погасить займ в срок. Заранее благодарит КИВА и ИМОН за поддержку и помощь.
texts.en: Alisher is a responsible and goal-oriented young man. For more than ten years, he has sold car parts. He personally travels to Tashkent to stock up on high quality products. His retail space is located in the center of the market. He also sells household goods. For more than ten years, he has spent his income on medical care for his wife, who is in a hospital in Tashkent. Alisher wants to provide her with treatment and care, and to bring her home once she is healthy again. He hopes to increase his income, and with that goal, he is requesting a loan, to widen his selection of products. He promises to repay the loan on time. He is thankful to Kiva and IMON for their support and assistance.

loans.use: to purchase goods to increase the selection available for retail

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Maricel has a shop that buys and sells gold dust. She is also doing "pamiling" or filtering gold dust in the river. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy gold dust to sell.

Maricel has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Maricel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy gold dust to sell.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. Gemma has a shop that sells used clothing or ukay-ukay. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy stocks of used clothing. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Gemma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of used clothing.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 8 children. Regina has a shop that sells breads and snacks & serves milk and coffee. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy snacks & coffee for the shop. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Regina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks & coffee for the shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bulbs and sockets.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a hardworking business-woman, aged forty. She is married and blessed with four children all of whom attend school.  For the last ten years, she has been running a business, renting houses to support her family.  She also practices dairy farming to supplement her income. 

Elizabeth has been able to retain her business because of her good reputation with her customers. She has requested for a loan of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy a cow.  She would like to express her gratitude to Faulu Kenya for training her on good customer care.

loans.use: to buy a cow for her dairy.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy is 42 years old. She lives in Nguyet Cau village, Yen Phong, Bac Ninh. She has two children. She has a general store where she sells dry goods, such as sugar, salt, noodles, instant noodles, garlic, rice and many other things. She has had this job for ten years. She has a monthly income of about 6,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). 

She has needed loans to expand her business, so she has participated in SEDA since 2008. The last time she borrowed 8,288,000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. This is the 5th time she is borrowing money from SEDA. In this loan cycle she would like to borrow 9,184,000 VND to buy more dry goods to sell, like rice, beans, noodles and other goods.

loans.use: to buy more dry goods to sell.

loans.name: Abdunabi

texts.ru: Абдунаби трудолюбивый и добросовестный человек. Он женат, имеет двох детей. Более 10 лет занимается предпринимательством. Он продает одеяла, простыни, полотенца и постельное белье. Данный бизнес он унаследовал от родителей. Ему в предпринимательстве помогает супруга. За товарами он ездит  в Китай. Более 15 циклов кредитуется в «Имон Интернэшнл» и стал успешным предпринимателем. Теперь он хочет получить  займ для расширения ассортимента товаров. Заранее благодарит  кредиторов КИВА и ИМОН за помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Abdunabi is a hard-working and honest man. He is married and has two children. For more than ten years, he has had a business. He sells blankets, bedsheets, towels, and other linens. He inherited this business from his parents. His wife helps him with his business. Abdunabi travels to China to acquire inventory. He has borrowed from Imon International more than 15 times, and has become a successful businessman. Now he would like a loan to expand his selection of goods. He is grateful in advance to Kiva lenders and IMON, for their help and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase goods with the goal of expanding his business

loans.name: Husain

texts.ru: Хусайн умный и трудолюбивый юноша. Он родился в 1990 году в семье педагога. В 1997 году он поступил в среднюю школу и закончил отлично. В 2007 году он поступил в Государственный Университет языков Таджикистана имени Сатим Улугзаде. В данный момент он учится на 4 курсе на факультете иностранных языков. Он учится отлично и всегда участвует на студенческих мероприятиях. Хусайн запрашивает займ для оплаты своего обучения и заранее благодарен вам за вашу доброту и помощь.
texts.en: Husain is an intelligent and hard-working youth. He was born in 1990, into a teacher's family. In 1997 he started school, graduating with excellent grades. In 2007 he was admitted to Tajikistan's Satim Ulugzade State University of Languages. Now he is in his fourth year, in the department of foreign languages. He is an excellent student and always participates in student events. Husain is asking for a loan to pay for his education, and is grateful in advance for your kindness and support.

loans.use: to pay for his education

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a hardworking business woman aged 57.  For the last ten years, she has been running a butcher shop to make a living.  She has employed two people to assist her to run the business.  In the next five years she plans to expand her business.  

Beatrice has requested a loan of 40,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy a cow to slaughter.  Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her business with a previous loan.

loans.use: to buy a cow to slaughter for her butcher shop.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is married and blessed with four children, three of whom are in school.  He describes himself as a hardworking businessman.  He owns a van, which he uses as a transport business.  He also runs a retail shop and farms to increase his income.  He has employed one person to assist him in the business. 

In the next five years he wants to expand his business.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to access loans to boost his business.  Phillip is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy spare parts for his van.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his van.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. Myrna has a pigpen and sells matured and grown pigs. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy animal feeds for the pigs. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Myrna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds for the pigs.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en: Joel is a hardworking business man aged 29 years-old and he is married. For the last three years, he has been operating a music shop where he mainly sells music CDs and DVDs.  He has retained his customers because of his good reputation.  He hopes to grow his business and expand his business premises in five years. He has requested a loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings to buy music CDs and DVDs to sell.

loans.use: to buy music CDs and DVDs to sell.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en: Jaime is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 4 children. Jaime is providing motorcycle or habal-habal services. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy tools for maintenance and pay for gasoline. He has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Jaime hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools for maintenance and pay for gasoline.

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en: Petronila is a hardworking business woman aged 25 years-old. She is married and blessed with two children who are in school. For the last four years, she has been running a grocery business to support her family. She also does farming to supplement her income. She has requested a loan of 15,000 Kenyan shillings to buy tomatoes, potatoes and onions to sell. In the next five years, she plans to establish a wholesale business.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, potatoes and onions to sell.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en: Leonarda is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with 1 child. Leonarda has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Leonarda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Kiseve

texts.en:
Kiseve is a focused business man, aged 39. He is married and blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. He has been selling clothes for the last seventeen years to support his family. He also runs a retail shop to supplement his income. In the next 5 years, he plans to expand his business. He dreams of managing a wholesale business in the future. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to access loans to boost his business. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 Kenya shillings to add to his stock of clothes for resale.

loans.use: To add to his stock of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renovate his business premises.

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.ru: Шухрат женат и имеет двоих детей. Он старательный и трудолюбивый человек. Его жена домохозяйка. Шухрат занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. В основном он сеет пшеницу и получает хороший урожай. В бизнесе помогает ему его любящая жена. Кроме этого он имеет дополнительный доход от услуг такси. На полученный доход он хочет сыграть свадьбу сына. Шухрат запрашивает займ для покупки семян пшеницы для посева. Он заранее благодарен кредиторам КИВА  за помощь и милосердие.
texts.en: Shuhrat is married and has two children. He is a hard-working man. His wife takes care of the home. Shuhrat grows crops. Mainly, he grows wheat, which brings in a good harvest. His loving wife helps him with his work. He also gets income by providing taxi services. He would like to use the extra money he makes on his son's wedding. Shuhrat is asking for a loan to purchase wheat to sow. He is grateful in advance to Kiva lenders for their support and generosity.

loans.use: to purchase wheat for sowing

loans.name: Ailene

texts.en: Ailene is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. Ailene has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Ailene hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en: Anthony is a hardworking business man aged 28 years-old and he is unmarried. He has been operating a motorbike transport business for the last one year to make a living. He also practices dairy farming to supplement his income. In the  next five years, he plans  to transform his business from a motorbike to a van transport business. Anthony is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings in order to buy a cow.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en: Elvira is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. Elvira has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2005. In the future, Elvira hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Silvano

texts.en: Silvano is married and blessed with three children all whom attend school. For the last six years, he has been running a grocery business to bring up his family. He also sells clothes to supplement his income. Silvano has employed two people to assist him in the business. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. He has requested for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings in order to buy fruits and potatoes to resell. He expresses his gratitude to Kiva partner Faulu Kenya for training him on good customer care.

loans.use: to buy fruit and potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a greenhouse and a dairy unit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase modern tools for car repair.

loans.name: Hakim

texts.ru: Хаким несмотря на свои молодые годы более 10 лет занимается предпринимательством, то есть купле продажей одеял, покрывал и т.д. Он женат и у них трое детей. В бизнесе помогает ему его добрая жена. За товаром он ездит сам в городе Бишкек и привозит хорошие товары. После смерти матери его отец передал свой бизнес сыну и с тех пор Хаким стал успешным бизнесменом. Займ запрашивает для расширения ассортимента товаров. Заранее благодарит ИМОН и КИВА за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Despite his young age, Hakim has spent more than ten years working in his business: selling blankets, bedspreads and other items. He is married and has three children. His kind wife helps him with the business. He personally travels to Bishkek to purchase quality goods. After the death of his mother, his father passed on the business to Hakim, and he has become a successful businessman. He is requesting a loan to expand his selection of products. He thanks in advance IMON and Kiva for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase goods with the goal of expanding his business

loans.name: Safar

texts.en: Safar is a 52 year-old man who sells carpets from his house. He has three years of experience in this field. He usually brings carpets from other countries and resells them at a profitable price. His monthly income is 300 AZN. This is a very profitable business because carpets are very popular and every family has at least one in their house. Carpets are also an integral part of marriage dowries. Safar is married and has two children.  He has applied for a loan of 1,200 AZN in order to purchase more carpets and increase his income.

loans.use: to purchase more carpets to cover customer demand.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Annie has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Annie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Annie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Kamila

texts.en: Kamila is a 32 year-old woman who raises and sells cattle in the small village of Imishli city. Kamila is married and has three children. Cattle breeding is the only financial income in her family. She has five years of experience in this field. Her monthly income from cattle selling is 350 AZN.  She applied for a 1,200 AZN loan in order to purchase more cattle and improve the life of her beloved children.

loans.use: to purchase three cattle and fodder.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase three milk cows.

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en:
Lucresia is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 

Lucresia has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Lucresia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Lucresia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Tohid

texts.en: Tohid is a 22 year-old vendor who sell food products in a small shop. He is married and has one child. He has three years of experience in this field. He sells rice, sugar, pickles, beverages and candies. His monthly income is 300 AZN. He is a good client of Kiva partner AqroInvest and has already completed two loans. Now he would like to expand his business and purchase more merchandise to increase his income. For this purpose he applied for a loan of 1,200 AZN.

loans.use: to purchase more food to increase his profit.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 39 years old, married, and a mother of four lovely children. She lives in Ngarariga on the outskirts of Limuru town. Her husband does poultry farming in the same area and also adds to family income.

Esther owns a boutique where she sells new clothes and shoes. She has been doing this for five years now. She gets a monthly income of KES 52,000.

This will be Esther's third loan with KADET LTD. She has repaid all her other loans successfully. With this loan she plans to expand her business by buying more clothes and shoes for sale during the festive season. 

In the future she would like to own a shop in Limuru town and become a successful business woman.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and shoes to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Dilmurod

texts.ru: Дилмурод молодой семьянин. Он женат и у них двое маленьких детей. Жена работает в колхозе. Он занимается выращивание и откормом крупного рогатого скота. На протяжении 11 лет он занимается этим видом бизнеса. На полученный доход он содержит семью. Он хочет приобрести еще несколько голов скота, для этого ему нужны средства. Он надеется на помощь кредиторов КИВА и заранее благодарен им в поддержке.
texts.en: Dilmurod is a young family man. He is married and has two small children. His wife works in a collective farm. He grows and feeds large horned cattle. During the last eleven years he has been in this business. He supports the family using the collected profit. He wants to buy several more heads of cattle and needs money. He hopes for the Kiva lenders' help and is thanking all of you for support in advance.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Vazgen

texts.ru:
Вазген родился в 1966 году. Он проживает в городе Иджеване (Ijevan). Вазген женат и у него два сына. Жена Вазгена работает медсестрой, младший сын учится в медицинском колледже, а старший - окончил техническое училище. Оба сына Вазгена проффесионально занимаются борьбой и уже достигли определенных успехов.  
7 лет Вазген жил и работал в России, а по возвращении на родину в 2005 году, он основал свой собственный бизнес: купил небольшое помещение и начал торговать мясом. Со временем Вазген развил свой бизнес и кроме торговли мясом, начал брать заказы на изготовление шашлыка и других блюд из мясных продуктов. Благодаря доходу, получаемому от своего мясного магазина, Вазген содержит свою семью и платит за обучение младшего сына. 
Вазгену необходим кредит на сумму 800.000 драм для покупки из соседних деревень мяса для своего бизнеса, а также холодильника для хранения мясных продуктов.
texts.en:
Vazgen was born in 1966. He lives in the town of Ijevan. Vazgen is married and has two sons. His wife works as a nurse, his younger son is studying in the medical school and his older son has graduated from a technical college. Both Vazgen's sons are professional wrestlers and have already achieved certain success. 

Vazgen had lived and worked in Russia for seven years and when he returned to his homeland in 2005 he started his own business. He bought a small space where he started to sell meat. Vazgen has grown his business in time and besides meat selling he also started to take orders to make shashlik (shish kebob) and other kinds of meat dishes. The profits from this business help Vazgen to support his family and pay for the education of his younger son.

Vazgen needs a loan in the amount of 80,000 dram to buy meat for his business from the neighboring villages as well as a refrigerator to store the meat products.

loans.use: to buy refrigerator and meat for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more food products.

loans.name: Gulomzhon

texts.ru: Гуломчон молодой перспективный целеустремленный человек. У него прекрасная жена и двое маленьких детей. Он очень заботливый семьянин. старается создать все условия для своих детей. Для достижения этих планов он наметил построить новый дом от доходов , полученных от предпринимательства. Он занимается выращиванием и откормом скота. Это очень доходоприносящий бизнес. В свободное время также предоставляет услуги такси на своей машине. Он хочет получить займ для заложения фундамента нового дома, для покупки стройматериалов. Он заранее благодарит КИВА за поддержку.
texts.en: Gulomzhon is an up-and-coming, driven young man. He has a wonderful wife and two young children. He is a very caring family man and is trying to create good living conditions for his children. To achieve these plans he setting out to build a new house from the profits of his business. His work is raising and feeding cattle. It is a very profitable business. In his free time, he also provides a taxi service using his car. He is requesting a loan to lay the foundation of the new house and to buy building materials. He thanks Kiva in advance for the support.

loans.use: Purchase building materials

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.ru: Гулшан жительница района Шахритус. Ей 40 лет. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Она имеет среднее образование. Два года как занимается торговлей. Гулшан арендует торговую точку на рынке. Она продает детскую и подростковую одежду. Кредит берет для покупки зимней детской одежды.
texts.en: Gulshan lives in the Shahrituz Region. She is 40 years old. She is married. She has three children. She has secondary education. She has been working as a vendor for two years. She leases a sales stand at the market. She sells clothing for children and teens. She is taking out a loan in order to buy winter clothing for children.

loans.use: to buy seasonal goods

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a married woman who has two children. She is 45 years old, residing at Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Alma owns and operates a business venture, cultivating fruit trees & harvesting fruit for sale to earn a living. She's been 3 years in this business. Each month, she earns about 4,000 PHP doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to pay for the cost of coconut harvesting. She has been a member of GDMPC for almost three years. In the future, Alma wants to expand her business and to finish the studies of her children.

loans.use: to pay for the cost of coconut harvesting.

loans.name: Gongseng Indah 5 Group

texts.en:
Emiyati is 43 years old and married with three children. Two of them are in school and one is still a baby. Since 1991 she has been renting out rooms in a boarding house. The business is going well but sometimes some of her clients don't pay the rent on time. Now she has 22 rooms that she rents. The income that she gets can help her husband to cover daily basic needs of the family. This is her first loan with VisionFund Indonesia. She wants to use this loan to pay for her children's school fees and uniforms.

In the future, she wants to renovate the rooms so that she can increase the rent. She also wants her children to go to university because she herself only passed middle school.

loans.use: to pay for children's school fees and uniforms.

loans.name: Sanobari

texts.ru: Санобар проживает в районе Шахритус. Она не замужем. Ей 20 лет. Санобар живет вместе с родителями. Она занимается торговлей на рынке. В основном продает детскую одежду. Этим видом деятельности занимается год. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Sanobar lives in the Shahrituz Region. She is single. She is 20 years old. Sanobar lives together with her parents. She works as a vendor at the market. She mostly sells children’s clothing. She has been in this business for a year. She is taking out a loan to increase her sales volume.

loans.use: to buy warm blankets, children's outfits and hats

loans.name: Chrisoper

texts.en:
Christoper is a resident of Murang'a in Central Kenya. He is age 45 and has been in farming for 15 years, with his farm currently producing milk and tea for the local market. He runs a retail shop in the local market for additional income. He is married with one child, aged 6.

Christoper has made a second loan request of 63,600 KES with Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the loan will boost his farming income and create employment for his wife as one of his farmhands. He is focusing on increasing his pure breeds in order to earn more from the farming business.

He is, however, concerned with the high fluctuations in milk prices.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Umoja Shg Group

texts.en:
Martin is the facilitator of Umoja SHG group. Martin and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Martin takes care of three children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to ensure food security for his family and educate his children. In the recent 2011 season, Martin had an excellent maize yield harvesting 8 ½ bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Martin was only able to harvest five bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Martin and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Martin will educate his children and ensure food security for his family.

In 2012, the members of Umoja SHG group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Martin is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 11 years now.

She requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell. In the future, Gina would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Yokub

texts.ru: Ёкуб женат и имеет двоих детей. Он добросовестный и трудолюбивый человек. Более 17 лет он занимается скотоводством и выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Он содержит скот за счет кормов произведенным самим. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить хороший прибыль. Ёкуб запрашивает займ для покупки 3 голов крупного рогатого скота. Он заранее благодарит вас за поддержку и милосердие.
texts.en: Yokub is married and has two children.  He is a conscientious and hardworking person.  He has been involved in animal husbandry and growing agricultural crops for over 17 years.  Yokub sustains the livestock by the fodder that he produces himself.  He wants to expand his business and make a good profit.  Yokub is requesting this loan for the purchase of three heads of cattle.  He thanks you in advance for the support and mercy.

loans.use: to purchase three cows

loans.name: Joesel

texts.en:
Joesel is 29 years old and is from the village of Pan-ay Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Joesel is married and has one child. To make a living, Joesel owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting rice for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Joesel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. He wanted to help improve his living situation and increase his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan amount of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase land for expanding the business. This loan will be the fourteenth loan taken out by Joesel from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase land for expanding the business.

loans.name: Nanjikabe Shg Group

texts.en:
Dismus is the facilitator of the Nanjikabe SHG group. Dismus and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Dismus takes care of three children at home. He joined One Acre Fund for One Acre Fund’s best prices and to ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Dismus had a very good maize yield harvesting six bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Dismus was only able to harvest 2 ½ bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Dismus and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Dismus will educate his children and invest in raising livestock.

In 2012, the members of Nanjikabe SHG group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Dismus is pictured with his group members. The field officer appears on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is 57 years old and widowed with 8 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her store.

Perla has borrowed and paid back 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her store for 10 years and also earns an income from raising pigs. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 61 years old. She is a widow with eight children.

Lolita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her sari-sari store.

Lolita has borrowed and paid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 20 years and also earns an income from farming sugar cane.

Lolita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 51 years old. She is married and has four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Cristina has a nipa-weaving business in the Philippines. Cristina requested a loan for PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of nipa to weave.

Cristina has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Cristina would like to expand her business to help her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of nipa to weave.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is a married woman who is 36 years old. She resides in Segatic Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Juvy owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products such as shampoo, napkins and many others to earn a living. She's been in this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 8,000 PHP doing this type of business.

She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. Juvy has been a member of GDMPC for three years. In the future, Juvy wants to build her house and to finish the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Adelita

texts.en:
Adelita is 53 years old and is married with three children.

Adelita works hard to provide for her family. She buys and sells recycled materials in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase more recycled materials to sell.

Adelita has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her recycled-materials business for two years. She also earns an income from food vending and farming sugar cane.

Adelita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more recycled materials to sell.

loans.name: Wekhoyela Shg Group

texts.en:
Bonface is the facilitator of the Wekhoyela SHG group. Bonface and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Bonface takes care of eight children at home. He joined One Acre Fund for affordable loans repayments and to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Bonface had an excellent maize yield harvesting 10 bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Bonface was only able to harvest four bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Bonface and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Bonface will educate his children and invest in raising livestock.

In 2012, the members of Wekhoyela SHG group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Bonface is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is married and works hard to support her family.

She has a rice farming business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from ready-to-wear and cosmetics. Virginia is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies and to pay for laborers' salaries for her rice farming business.

Virginia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies and pay for laborers' salaries.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is 54 years old and widowed. She has two children, and she works very hard to provide for them.

Lucila runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 22,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.

Lucila has been in this business for six years. She sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, biscuits, etc.

In the future, Lucila would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Upendo Group

texts.en:
Evans is the facilitator of the Upendo group. Evans and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Evans takes care of two children at home. He joined One Acre Fund for their quality teachings on how to plant and to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Evans had an excellent maize yield harvesting 10 bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Godwin was only able to harvest 4 ½ bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Evans and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Evans will educate his children and invest in raising livestock.

In 2012, the members of Upendo group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Evans is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is 28 years old and married with 2 children.

Josie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a charcoal retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of charcoal to sell.

Josie has borrowed and paid back 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal retail business for 5 years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport.

Josie aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Nakitang'a Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Nakitang'a Group in Western Kenya! Bethsheba is the facilitator of the Nakitang'a group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Bethsheba takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to have quality teaching on how to plant and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Bethsheba had an excellent maize yield harvesting 20 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Bethsheba was only able to harvest four bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Bethsheba and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Bethsheba will educate her children and invest in raising livestock.

Bethsheba is pictured with her group members in the photograph above.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Namanjalala Group

texts.en:
Esther is the facilitator of the Namanjalala group. Esther and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Esnas takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund to have quality planting lessons and to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Esther had an excellent maize yield harvesting 12 bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Esther was only able to harvest 2 ½ bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Esther and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Esther will pay for major annual expenses such as school fees for the children.
 
In 2012, the members of Namanjalala group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Esther is pictured with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Pasar Lontar Group

texts.en:
Enung continues to sell toys from her shop. She is taking another loan with VisionFund Indonesia to expand her business. Because this is her second loan with VisionFund Indonesia, she can borrow more money than before and expand her business faster. Her last loan helped the business by adding more toys. It also helped improve her family's standard of living.

After the group paid back their first KIVA loan, one of the group members left because she no longer needed a loan for her business.

loans.use: to pay for children's toys like cars and rackets to sell in her children's toy store.

loans.name: Weya Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Weya SHG Group in Western Kenya!  Esther is the facilitator of the Weya SHG group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Esther takes care of eight children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to have quality farm produce and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Esther had a good maize yield harvesting 16 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Esther was only able to harvest seven bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Esther and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Esther will educate her children and invest in raising livestock.

In the above photograph, Esther is pictured with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Emarald Seeder Group

texts.en: This is 46-year-old Synodia from Harare. She is married with six children, two attending school. Synodia runs a retail business selling stationery and school uniforms. The business has been in operation for 2 years. She says the main challenge faced is working capital constraints. Synodia has requested a loan of $400 to buy more stock. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to pay school fees for her children without any problems. In the future, Synodia plans to own a bigger shop.

loans.use: To buy more stationery stock.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a farmer in Nkubu area of Central Kenya aged 40 years and married with 3 children aged 17,13 and 9 and all schooling. She has been in farming for 18 years with her farm currently producing cabbage, potatoes, beans, maize, milk and fodder, which she sells to the local market.

Beatrice has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a water tank to help her in harvesting water for her farm. She adds that a consistent water supply will help her earn more from her animal feed sales to the local dairy farmers as well as reduce the cost of feed for her dairy cows.

She laments poor market prices for the farming products. She appreciates Juhudi Kilimo's loan services.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Tichakunda Group

texts.en:
This is 52-year-old Elizabeth from Harare. She is part of Tichakunda Group. She is married with six children. She also cares for two dependents who help her to run an agriculture business selling chickens. The business has been in operation for 2 years. She says the main challenge faced is that chicks are badly affected in poor weather. 

Elizabeth has requested a loan of $400 to buy chicken feed. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the standard of living of her family. In the future, she plans to increase the stock level of chicks.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Arcely

texts.en:
Arcely is from Ozamis, Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old. Arcely is a widow and has four adult-aged children. 

To make a living, Arcely owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale such as eggplant, squash and many others in the local community. Arcely has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Arcely is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield.

In 2009, Arcely joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Upendo B Group

texts.en:
Benard is the facilitator of the Upendo B group. Benard and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Benard takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to obtain their quality farm products and to have additional maize profits to educate his children. In the recent 2011 season, Benard had a very good maize yield harvesting 12 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Benard was only able to harvest three bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Benard and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Benard will educate his children and pay his loans and debts.

In 2012, the members of Upendo B group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Benard is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Cornelius

texts.en: Cornelius lives in the town of Kitale in Western Kenya, where he has worked as a farmer for the last four years, producing mostly milk and eggs for the local market. He is 28 years old, single, and also runs a money-transfer business with a local mobile telecommunication firm. He is applying for a loan for 30,000 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to help expand his poultry-farming business by buying more chickens. He believes there is potential for growth here and hopes to become a large-scale provider of poultry products in the near future. He plans to repay this loan with the increased money he earns from his business. His  main challenges are the high cost of feed and the prevention of animal disease.

loans.use: to increase egg production by buying more chickens.

loans.name: Amua B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Amua B Group in Western Kenya!  Annet is the facilitator of the Amua B group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Annet takes care of eight children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Annet had an excellent maize yield harvesting 16 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Annet was only able to harvest three bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Annet and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Annet will ensure food security and save for the future.

In 2012, the members of Amua B group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

In the above photograph, Annet is pictured with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Tamutswa Group

texts.en: Angeline is 51 years old and lives in Harare with her husband and five children who range in age from 18 to 31. She also cares for one other dependent. She earns a living by making footballs, which she sells in the nearby town of Glen-View. She has been in this line of work for three years and says that her main challenge is a lack of capital. She is applying for a loan for $300 to buy more of the materials she needs to make footballs, and believes that this loan will allow her to increase her income and improve her standard of living. In the future, she hopes to open a large factory for making footballs.

loans.use: to buy materials to make footballs.

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en:
Immaculee is 27 years old and is married with two children aged between two and four years old.  She owns a business selling various goods such as biscuits, lotions and toothpaste.  She has two years' experience in this business and the hours of her work are from 6am until 9pm every day except on Saturday.  She currently employs one person to help her. 

Immaculee has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various goods such as biscuits, lotions, toothpaste and sugar to sell.  With any profits, she will be able to save for her future, reinvest in her business and be able to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase various goods such as biscuits, lotions and toothpaste to sell.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr:
Abla est une femme âgée de 37 ans. Elle est mariée à un menuisier. Elle a 2 enfants, dont un va à l’école. Le premier à 8 ans et le dernier a 2 ans.
Abla travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2006. Elle achète et revend des charbons pour tous les clients à Lomé. Elle achète les produits dans les villages. Elle travaille seule et n’a aucun employé. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est le manque d’argent pour satisfaire toute la demande.
ABla a requis son premier cycle de crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter et revendre du charbon. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Abla voudrait élargir l’activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Abla is a 37-year-old woman. She is married to a carpenter. She has two children, one of whom attends school. Her older and younger children are 8 and 2 years old, respectively. Abla has worked as a retailer since 2006. She buys and re-sells charcoal to all types of customers in Lomé. She buys the products in various towns. She works by herself and has no employees. Currently, her main difficulty is a lack of money to satisfy the full demand. Abla has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy and re-sell charcoal. She wants to reinvest in her business. 
In the coming years, Abla would like to expand her business. She says that with the profits, she intends to take care of her family.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Holy Girls Group

texts.en:
Sharon is 36 years old, married, and has three children.  She lives in Machipisa, near Harare.  Her husband is employed as a truck driver.

Sharon is a cross-border trader and travels each month by bus to South Africa to buy clothes to sell back home.  She has been doing this for three years. 

Sharon is requesting a loan for $4OO, which she will use to buy clothes to sell. She finds it difficult to balance looking after her children with long periods of absence at home.  In addition, fluctuating exchange rates and customs duties impact on her profitability. Over time, she would like to have her own shop.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell in the market.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a farmer who lives in Central Kenya. She is 42 years old and has been in this line of work for 20 years. She currently produces coffee, milk and tea for sale in the local market. She is a widow who has two children, both of whom are adults. Mary is applying for a loan for 53,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to by and insure a dairy cow. She plans to use the milk this cow produces in own meals and sell the surplus in the local market. She is very focused on increasing her income by generating a greater output from her farm. Her main challenge is the high variability in the price of milk, but she is confident that this loan will allow her to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Maura

texts.en:
Maura is 60 years old, widowed, and has nine children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Maura runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 11 years.  She also earns additional income from selling tobacco and vegetables. 

Maura is requesting a loan for 23,000 PHP through NWTF, which she will use to buy items such as shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store. Maura has borrowed and repaid 20 loans from NWTF.  She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell  in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Monique

texts.en:
Monique is 33 years old and is married with one child who is two years old.  She owns a business selling various goods such as sugar, toothpaste and biscuits.  She has three years' experience in this business and the hours of her work are from 6am until 8.30pm every day.  She currently employs one person to help her. 

Monique has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various goods such as
sugar, toothpaste, biscuits, rice and beans to sell.  With any profits, she will be able to save for her future and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase various goods such as sugar, toothpaste and biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Purita

texts.en: Purita is 51 years old, married and has 10 children. She works hard to provide for her family by running a sari-sari (or variety) store in the Philippines. She is applying for a loan for PHP 29,500 loan from NWTF to buy more items to sell to her customers. She has been in this line of work for five years and supplements her income by selling gasoline. Her main goal for the future is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Madeline

texts.en: Madeline is 68 years old, married, and has four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Madeline has a sari-sari store (general store) in the Philippines. Madeline requested a 29,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items like canned goods, biscuits, soft drinks, shampoo, etc. to sell in her store. Madeline has been in this business for 18 years. In the future, Madeline would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods, biscuits, soft drinks, and shampoo to sell in her store

loans.name: Sungai Bambu Group

texts.en:
Lela is 37 years old and married with three children. She has been selling snacks such as "risol" (fried dough pockets filled with vegetables), "piscok" (spring roll-like snacks filled with banana and chocolate), and "ketan" (sweet sticky rice) for ten years. She sells the snacks from a stand in front of her house and distributes orders to small stores. The business has been going well and she is able to help her family by having a constant stream of income. Her husband is the neighborhood leader so he only makes a modest salary. 

This is her fourth loan with VisionFund Indonesia. She will use it to buy more ingredients and pay school fees for her children who are in elementary school. She hopes to also add "nasi uduk" (an Indonesian coconut rice dish) to her business soon. She also hopes that she will eventually have enough savings to make improvements to their home.

loans.use: to pay for more ingredients to make fried snacks to sell.

loans.name: Betty's Group

texts.en:
Betty's group is comprised of two hard-working women. Betty is 19 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala West region of Uganda. For the past two years, Betty has been working hard to manage her poultry farm, which sells chicken. 

To help expand her business, Betty has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more feed for the chickens, which will help Betty to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself.
