Faustin fait partie du groupe Abishyizehamwe no 1/Kbz. Il a 32 ans et il est marié avec 3 enfants de 5 mois à 10 ans, dont 3 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6  ans de primaire.

Faustin est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques et payement main d’œuvre pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de faire la semence sélectionnée du riz.  Dans les prochaines années, Faustin voudrait être le grossiste. Avec les profits, Faustin prévoit d’éduquer et payer les frais médicaux pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Faustin is part of the Abishyizehamwe no 1/Kbz group. He is 32 years old and is married with three children whose ages range from 5 months to 10 years. Three of them attend school. His own level of education was 6 years of primary school.

Faustin is a rice farmer. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He will use his credit loan to buy fertilizers and pay the labor for his rice-growing activity.

His strategy for growing his business is to use selected rice seedlings. In coming years, Faustin wants to become a wholesaler. With the profits, Faustin plans to pay for his family's medical and educational expenses.

loans.use: buy fertilizers and pay the labor for his rice-growing activity.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet lives in Uganda. She is married and has five children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (including a niece). Janet's business is a retail shop. She has been in this business for two years, and she works seven days out of every week. Janet sells household products in her retail shop and also generates additional income by selling secondhand clothes. Janet has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of rice, maize flour, sugar and boxes of soap. The main business challenges for Janet include seasonality and ever increasing prices of commodities in Uganda. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked shop and also to become a wholesaler. Janet lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family, rent for her business premises and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bags of rice, maize flour, sugar and boxes of soap.

loans.name: Enid

texts.en: Enid lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has eight children, four of whom are in school. Enid's business is a home products retail shop. She has been in this business for ten years, and she works seven days out of every week. Enid has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of rice, maize flour, sugar, and boxes of soap. The main business challenges for Enid include seasonality and ever increasing prices of commodities in Uganda. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked shop and also to become a wholesaler. Enid lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family, rent for her business premises, and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bags of rice, sugar, boxes of soap, and maize flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow and poultry birds.

loans.name: Sigyongyaakadi Group

texts.fr:
Mme Safiatou est la représentante du groupe SIGYONGYAAKADI. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Le plus âgé a 12ans et le moins âgé a 4ans.2 vont a l’école et elle a 3 personnes en charge.

Elle vend des pagnes depuis 4 ans. Mme s’approvisionne au marché du secteur 10.Ses clients sont les femmes.

Elle veut s’acheter 17 complets de pagnes.

Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut mieux s’occuper de sa famille. Elle ambitionne aider son mari à construire leur maison et voyager pour amener les pagnes et vendre en gros
texts.en:
Ms. Safiatou is the representative of the Sigyongyaakadi group. She is married with three children. The oldest is 12 years old and the youngest is four. Two of them attend school and all three are dependents.

She has been selling pagnes (colorful West-African fabric) for the past four years. She gets her supplies from the Sector 10 market. Her customers are women. She wants to buy 17 full pagne sets (skirt, blouse and scarf)..

With her profits, she wants to take better care of her family. Her ambition is to help her husband build their house and to travel to buy and deliver pagnes wholesale.

loans.use: Buy 17 complete pagne sets

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto,  de 44 años de edad, soltero, no tiene hijos, vive en una aldea de Baracoa Cortes.
Es un señor muy trabajador, siempre ha tenido la  vocación de ser enfermero y ha logrado este sueño. Tuvo la oportunidad de alquilar un local  hace 8 años y logro establecer  una pequeña farmacia donde vende medicamentos básicos y presta el servicio de enfermería en la comunidad,  sus deseos son servir a los demás y a personas que necesiten de primeros auxilios.
Anteriormente desde joven trabajaba en la agricultura y todavía hace esta actividad, tiene 3 manzanas de terreno cultivado de granos básicos como de maíz y frijoles, donde obtiene otros ingresos.
A la farmacia le dedica más tiempo y para el cultivo paga jornaleros para que le den el mantenimiento debido.
A solicitado tres prestamos anteriores para surtir la farmacia y mantenimiento y asistencia al cultivo, este es el cuarto préstamo y quiere comprar un equipo de oxigeno para los servicios de enfermería y surtir la farmacia. Tambien dejar una parte para comprar fertilizantes para mejorar el cultivo.
texts.en:
Roberto is 44 years old. He is single, has no children, and lives in the neighborhood of Baracoa Cortes.

Roberto is a hardworking gentleman. He always wanted to be in the nursing profession and was able to achieve this dream. Eight years ago, Roberto took the opportunity to rent a location where he established a small pharmacy in order to sell basic medicines and provide his services as a nurse to the community. He desires to serve others by helping those who are in need of primary care.

Roberto previously worked as a farmer when he was a young man and still engages in agricultural activities. He has three plots of land on which he grows basic crops, such as corn and beans, as a means of earning additional income.

Roberto requested three previous loans in order to stock his pharmacy and maintain his crops. This is his fourth loan and he wants to buy oxygen equipment to use in providing nursing services and to restock his pharmacy. He also wants to use part of this loan to buy fertilizers to improve his crops.

loans.use: to buy oxygen equipment, medicines, and fertilizers for his crops.

loans.name: El Arbolito Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Carmen tiene 46 años, es casada, tiene 3 hijos y es la presidenta de la Alcancía Comunal “El Arbolito”. Se dedica a la compra y venta de artefactos usados; con el cual  lleva 8 años y que comenzó con la venta de triciclos usados a raíz de poder conseguir abrir una chatarrería y así obtener mayor rentabilidad para su negocio. Hasta ahora ha logrado construir su casa y comprarse algunos electrodomésticos, sus ingresos están destinados a los gastos de casa y ahorro, su plan para el futuro es abrir una chatarrería cerca de su casa y comprarse una moto; Carmen tiene pensado usar el reciente préstamo para seguir adquiriendo artículos de segunda como refrigeradoras, congeladoras, televisores y otros electrodomésticos para así revenderlos. 

Ella comparte los gastos con su esposo, quien se encarga del pago de luz y agua, tiene 3 años con el grupo el cual esta conformado por 10 personas y que se formo a través de la visita por parte del analista a una de las señoras pertenecientes al grupo; Carmen lleva 2 años como presidenta del grupo.
texts.en:
Carmen, 46, is married and has three children.  She is the president of the El Arbolito communal bank.

Carmen has been working buying and selling used appliances for eight years.  She began with the sale of used tricycles as a result of being able to open a scrapyard and so get greater profits for her business.

Up to now she has managed to build a house and buy herself a few electrical appliances.  Her income is dedicated to household expenses and savings.  Her plan for the future is to open a scrapyard near her house and buy herself a motorcycle.

Carmen plans to use the recent loan to continue acquiring used items such as refrigerators, freezers, television sets, and other electrical appliances to resell.

Carmen shares expenses with her husband, who is responsible for paying the electricity and water.

She has been with the group for three years, one of 10 people who formed a group after a visit from an analyst to one of the women in the group.  Carmen has been president of the group for two years.

loans.use: to buy appliances such as freezers and refrigerators.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
La señora Candelaria tiene 49 años de edad, vive con su compañero de vida y sus cinco hijos.

Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, que se dedica a la agricultura a sembrar maíz y fríjol. Para ayudar a su esposo y brindarle el estudio a sus cinco hijos. Antes Candelaria solo se ocupaba de los oficios del hogar, pero decidió ayudar a su esposo y cultivar granos y a la crianza de cerdos.

Los animales son comprados en una ciudad cercana a su vivienda, que esta a una hora en autobús, una  vez los compra los traslada a su vivienda en compañía de uno de uno de sus hijos que le ayuda.

La señora Candelaria, solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar un cerdo y 100 pollos de engorde y  el concentrado para alimentarlos. Ella tiene experiencia en esta actividad, por lo que manifiesta que es muy rentable.

Con el préstamo Candelaria diversificara sus especies y obtendrá mayores ingresos al ofrecer variedad y mayor cantidad. Lo cual le servirá de mucho, para el sostenimiento de su familia. Ella espera contar con una granja bien establecida y proporcionar el estudio a sus hijos para que sean unos profesionales.
texts.en:
Candelaria is 49 years old.  She lives with her life partner and her five children.

Candelaria is a very hard-working woman who farms, growing corn and beans, in order to help her husband and provide her five children with an education.  In the past, she used to solely take care of her household chores but she decided to help her husband, growing grains and raising pigs.

The animals are bought in a nearby town which is one hour away by bus.  Once she has bought them, she transports them home with the help of one of her children.

Candelaria is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo to buy a pig and 100 chickens to fatten.  She will also buy concentrate to feed them with.   She has experience in this business and she says that it is very profitable.

With her loan, Candelaria will diversify her species and obtain more income by offering a variety of animals and in larger quantities.  This will help her a lot in supporting her family.  She hopes to have a well-established farm and to provide her children with an education so that they can become professionals.

loans.use: to buy a pig and 100 chickens to fatten, and to buy concentrate to feed them with

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.ru:
Надежда живет и работает в Мелитополе. Она торгует хозтоварами, посудой и предметами первой необходимости на центральном рынке своего города. Направление в бизнесе помогли выбрать друзья. У нее хорошее торговое место и приемлемые цены на весь ряд товаров. В этом бизнесе Надежда уже 15 лет. Товара у нее сейчас на 60 000 гривен.  

Надежда планирует использовать кредит в 18 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить партию товара, разнообразить ассортимент и увеличить валовую прибыль. Она надеется и дальше развивать бизнес и улучшать быт семьи. За счет прибыли, полученной от выручки, Надежда хотела бы закончить ремонт в доме. 

Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Nadezhda lives and works in Melitopol. She sells kitchen wares and household goods at the central city market. Her friends have helped her choose the focus of her store. Nadezhda's store is in a good location and her prices are the lowest in her row. She has been managing her store for the last 15 years and she currently owns 60,000 grivn worth of goods. 

Nadezhda is planning to use her loan of 18,000 grivn to purchase additional goods for her store so that she can offer more choices to her customers and so increase the store's profits. She is hoping to continue expanding her business and improve her family's living conditions. Nadezhda is planning to use the extra profits from the expansion of her store to do repairs to her house.

Note: History is in Russian.

loans.use: to purchase goods for her store

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is age 59 and is a mother of five adult children, with the last three undergoing their post-secondary education. She has been in farming for 40 years and currently produces maize and milk for the local market. She is also a government retiree and receives a pension for additional income.

Margaret has requested a loan of 62,400 Kenya shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that the cow will improve her milk production and enable her provide her children with food as well as ensure their education in college. She hopes to be the major supplier of milk for the local dairy plant.

Margaret notes with regret the high costs of farming supplies.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio tiene 55 años de edad y es casado y tiene 2 hijos; El socio sigue en su negocio de transporte,el es propietrio de un taxi y hace servicio publico,el socio trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m en las diferentes calles de la ciudad de Cusco,por medio de este trabajo el socio saca adelante a sus hijos,el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de transporte . El  socio solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento de su carro para comprar repuestos
                                                
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member is 55 years old, married, and has two children.  He continues working in his transport business.  He owns a taxi and provides a public transport service.  He works from 7.00am to 10.00pm in the different streets of the city of Cusco.  Through this work he provides for his children.  The member would like to expand and improve his transport business.  He is requesting this loan to have maintenance work carried out on his car and to buy spare parts.

The member is happy to be receiving his loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to have maintenance work carried out on his car and to buy spare parts

loans.name: Las Rosas De Maria Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Armandina tiene 57 años D. edad, es soltera y tiene 2 hijos que son independientes. Tiene 2 años con Edaprospo - Prosperidad y se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes como azúcar, leche, arroz y otros; tiene 10 años en este negocio y comenzó con la venta D. pan que muy posteriormente se fue incrementando; también se dedica a la venta D. hielos desD. hace 8 años, hasta el momento ya ha logrado construir su casa y comprarse algunos artefactos. Los gastos que cubren sus ingresos están destinados a las necesidades del hogar y ahorros.

Su plan para el futuro es seguir trabajando en su bodega y comprarse electrodomésticos para su casa. Piensa usar el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. mercadería para su negocio; ella pertenece a la Alcancía Comunal “Las Rosas D. María” con el cual tiene 2 años y que esta conformado por 7 personas, que se formó tras un acuerdo entre sus vecinos que necesitaban D. un préstamo, el nombre lo pusieron debido a que la mayoría del grupo estaba conformada por mujeres. Ella lleva 1 años como presidenta.
texts.en:
Armandina is 57 years old. She is single and has two grown children. She has been with Edaprospo - Prosperidad for 2 years, and she sells groceries like sugar, milk, rice and other items. Armandina has been in this business for ten years; she began by selling bread and much later began expanding. She has also sold ice for eight years. Armandina has managed to build her house and buy some items for it. Her income covers her household needs and goes toward savings.

Her plan for the future is to keep working in her grocery store and buy some household appliances for her house. She is thinking of using the loan to buy merchandise for her business. She belongs to the “Las Rosas D. María” (Mary's Roses) communal bank, which has seven members, and she has been one of the members for two years. The communal bank was formed after Armandina's neighbors agreed that they needed a loan. They chose the group's name based on the fact that most of the group members were women. Armandina has been the president for one year.

loans.use: to buy new merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA GENERACION III”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Juan Pablo; el tiene 75 años de edad y es casado y tiene 7 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta materiales eléctricos como cables, herramientas entre otros materiales, el socio también se dedica a realizar instalaciones eléctricas, el trabaja en forma independiente desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,por medio de este trabajo el socio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de materiales eléctricos. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales eléctricos al por mayor como cables y herramientas. 

 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Juan Pablo is a member of the 'Nueva Generación III' community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Juan Pablo is 75 years old, married, and has seven children.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his business selling electrical supplies such as cables, tools and other materials.  He also works as an electrician.  He is self employed and works from 7.00am to 5.00pm.  Through this work he provides for his children.  Juan Pablo would like to expand and improve his business selling electrical supplies.  He is requesting this loan to buy electrical supplies wholesale such as cables and tools. 

Juan Pablo is happy to be receiving his loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy electrical supplies wholesale such as cables and tools

loans.name: Yelena

texts.ru:
Елена не замужем. У нее есть взрослая дочь Марина, ей 20 лет. Они живут в Никополе. Елена занимается розничной торговлей детской одеждой. У Елены всегда есть качественный товар на любой кошелек и вкус, поэтому на товар всегда есть спрос и постоянные покупатели. Елена начинала свое дело 11 лет назад. Тогда она работала на рынке, но потом перевела свою торговлю с базара в магазин. Теперь товар не затаскивается и не пачкается, а также появилось больше места, чтобы разложить одежду. Кроме того, Елена умело выбирает закупаемый товар, она зарекомендовала себя, как опытный и прилежный предприниматель.  

Елене необходимо финансовое содействие в виде кредита в 6 000 гривен для того, чтобы оплатить 2 семестр обучения дочери в вузе. У Елены нет такой крупной суммы на руках, а внести оплату нужно сразу и целиком. Полученные средства помогут Елене непосредственно заплатить за обучение дочери, а она сможет потом выплатить кредит постепенно. Будучи матерью одиночкой, Елена понимает, что ей не на кого рассчитывать, поэтому она очень надеется на кредит от КИВА.   
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en: Yelena is not married and has an adult daughter, Marina, who is 20 years old.  They live in Nikipol.  Yelena is involved in retail sales of children's clothing.  She always carries quality merchandise to satisfy every budget and taste, and this is why her merchandise is always in demand, and she has regular customers.  Yelena started her business 11 years ago.  At that time, she worked at a market, but then transferred her sales from the market to a store.  Now her merchandise does not get worn and dirty, and she has more space to display the clothing.  Besides, Yelena carefully selects the merchandise she buys and, thus, established herself as an experienced and diligent entrepreneur.  Yelena needs financial assistance in the form of a loan of 6,000 hryvnia to pay for her daughter's second semester of university study.  Yelena does not have such a large sum on hand, but the payment needs to be made right away and in full.  Obtained funds will help Yelena to pay for her daughter's education directly, and then she will be able to repay the loan gradually.  Being a single mother, Yelena understands that she has no one to count on and, hence, relies on the loan from Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's second semester of university study

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more beauty products

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is age 40 and has 15 years of experience in active farming in her home area of Murang'a in Central Kenya. She is single and fully relies on her farming for her upkeep. Her farm produce of vegetables and milk go to the local market. She also provides tailoring services for additional income.

Esther has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a water pump for her farming business. She adds that insufficient water supply has been a great limitation, so adding a water pump will ensure steady production from her farm and enable her to have good income for daily upkeep.

Esther mentions drought as the main challenge in farming.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more roots and gins (country gin) for her business.

loans.name: Blanca Sonia

texts.es:
La señora Blanca tiene 35 años D. edad, es casada con dos hijos.
Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora, desD. la edad D. 15 años comenzó a trabajar en la compra y venta D. cerdos, esta actividad la heredo D. sus padres. Antes Blanca solo se ocupaba D. los oficios del hogar, pero decidió ayudar con los gastos del hogar, por medio D. la comercialización D. cerdos, el cual es muy rentable.
Blanca camina a pie durante veinticinco minutos, luego aborda un  autobús por una hora, hasta llegar al lugar donD. compra los cerdos para llevarlos a su casa y engordarlos para la venta.   
La señora Blanca, solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar dos cerdos y dos sacos D. concentrado para alimentarlos, y venderlos en la zona urbana ya que es rentable su venta. Ella actualmente no tiene cerdos, por que no cuenta con el capital para comprarlos. Con el ingreso que reciba Blanca apoyara a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. También Blanca desea construir una galera para  tener ahí sus cerdos y ayudar a su hijo para que estudie el bachillerato.
texts.en:
Blanca is 35 years old and she is married with two children. She is a very enterprising woman, since she was 15 years old she has worked in the buying and selling of pigs, which was her parents' traD.. 

Previously, Blanca just occupied herself with the household tasks, but she decided to help with the household expenses by trading pigs, which is very profitable. Blanca travels on foot for twenty-five minutes, then by bus for an hour, to get to the place where she buys the pigs so she can take them home and fatten them up to ready them for sale. 

Blanca is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo so she can buy two pigs and two bags of feed for them, and then sell them in the urban area where their sale is very profitable. At the moment she doesn't have any pigs because she doesn't have the capital to buy them. Blanca will use the income to help her husband with the household expenses. She also wants to build a pen for her pigs and to help her son so that he can gain a high school education.

loans.use: to buy two pigs and two bags of feed for them.

loans.name: Barbara

texts.en:
Barbara lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has four children, two of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members, including her sister’s daughter and a brother. 

Barbara has a business selling bananas. She has been in this business for 7 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Barbara sells her products in a shop, by means of retail. Barbara has requested  for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas.

The main business challenges for Barbara include seasonality, thieves, and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler and to start building rental rooms. Barbara lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include medication and school.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Maria Nelsy

texts.es:
Maria Nelsy, tiene 55 años de edad, casada desde hace 22 años, tiene 4 hijos de 22, 28, 30 y 32 años de edad, vive en San Manuel Cortes.
Doña María es una señora muy trabajadora, tiene 10 años de haber iniciado su negocio de venta de productos de la canasta básica familiar, como azúcar, frijoles, carnes, sal, arroz, huevos, pollo, refrescos, churros confites etc. Atiende a sus clientes todo el día juntamente con la ayuda de su esposo. Este negocio esta ubicado en un lugar accesible para los clientes.
Este es su octavo préstamo que a solicitado para surtir cada día mas su negocio, del cual a logrado obtener los ingresos para el sostenimiento de la familia y una  mejor calidad de vida. en su casa hay un apartamento anexado y lo tiene alquilado de allí tiene otros ingresos.
Su sueño es mantener su negocio más surtido y de las utilidades construir apartamentos para obtener más ingresos en un futuro.
texts.en:
María Nelsy is 55 years old and has been married for 22 years. She has four children (ages 22, 28, 30, and 32) and lives in San Manuel Cortes.

Doña María is a hardworking woman. Ten years ago, she began selling basic food products such as sugar, beans, meat, salt, rice, eggs, chicken, soft drinks, donuts, candy, and other items. She attends to her customers every day with the help of her husband. This business is located in a place that is accessible for her customers.

This is the eighth loan she has requested so that she can stock her business each day. With the income she has earned, María has been able to sustain her family and achieve a better quality of life. In her house, there is a connected apartment that she rents out in order to generate extra income.

Her dream is to keep her business well-stocked and use the profits to build additional apartments so that she can earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to buy sugar, beans, meat, salt, rice, eggs, chicken, soft drinks, donuts, candy, and other items.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace lives in Uganda. She is single and has eight children, four of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members, including her sister’s daughter. 

Grace has a business of selling second-hand clothes. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Grace sells her products in a shop, by means of retail. Grace has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. She also generates additional income through selling paint.

The main business challenges for Grace include seasonality, thieves, and ever-increasing prices of used clothes in Uganda. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler and to start importing used clothes. Grace lives in a home that she owns; she has access to both electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family, paying rent for her business premises, and paying school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy household products.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has four children, all of whom are in school. She doesn't take care of   of additional family members. Edith has a business of a beauty salon. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works seven days out of every week. Edith sells her products in a shop, by means of retail.

Edith has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of cream relaxers and weaves. She also generates additional income through motorcycle for hire and tailoring. The main business challenges for Edith include seasonality and ever-increasing prices of cosmetics in Uganda. 

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked salon and also to own a bridal salon.  Edith lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family, rent for her business premises and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers and braids.

loans.name: Cristobal

texts.es:
¡Saludos desde Honduras! Le presento Cristobal. El señor Cristobal tiene 30 años de edad y vive en la aldea de Monte Verde en el departamento Cortes.  Lleva 5 años de casado con su esposa Ericka, la cual es ama de casa y cuida a sus dos hijos de 3 años y 6 meses de edad. Cristobal gana el único fuente de ingresos de la familia. 

Don Cristobal se dedica a la pesca. Por los últimos 15 años Cristobal ha pescado en el lago Yojoa. Pesca el lunes, martes y miércoles de las 6 de la mañana a las 5 de la tarde. Cristobal vende su pescado a comerciantes que tienen puestos de pescado junto al lago. El lago es muy pintoresco y está rodeado por montañas. En la orilla del lago hay muchos restaurantes donde venden pescado frito. Se dice que es el pescado más rico de Honduras. 

Solicitó un crédito anterior con ODEF de L5000 y ahora cuenta con un poco más equipo y mobiliario para la pesca. Cristobal ha solicitado este crédito de L10,000 para reparar su lancha y comprar equipo. Espera generar más ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares. En el futuro, Cristobal desea poner un puesto para la venta de comida.
texts.en:
Greetings from Honduras! This is Cristobal. He is 30 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Monte Verde in the Department of Cortes. He has been married for five years to his wife Ericka, who is a homemaker and takes care of their two children (ages 3 and 6 months). Cristobal is the only breadwinner in the family.

Don Cristobal is a fisherman. For the past 15 years, he has been fishing on Lake Yojoa. He goes fishing on Mondays, Tuesdays, and Wednesdays from 6am to 5pm. Cristobal sells his fish to merchants who have vending posts next to the lake. The lake is very picturesque and surrounded by mountains. On the shore of the lake, there are many restaurants that serve fried fish. The fish from this lake is known for being the most flavorful in Honduras.

Cristobal requested 5000 HNL in his previous loan from ODEF. Now he wants to acquire a little more equipment and amenities for his fishing business. Cristobal is requesting a loan in the amount of 10,000 HNL so that he can repair his boat and purchase equipment. He hopes to generate more income so that he can cover the family expenses. In the future, Cristobal wants to open a stand where he can sell food.

loans.use: to repair his boat and to buy equipment.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, two of whom go to school. She takes care of one additional family member, her mother. 

Susan has a restaurant at the market. She has rental houses as her other source of income. Susan works seven days a week. She has been in this business for the last six years. She has requested a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO to buy rice, bunches of bananas, beef, and sweet potatoes.

Her major business challenges are transportation, defaulters, and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to own a fully stocked hotel and also to build more rental rooms. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses are school fees and paying utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas, rice, beef, and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: San Isidro De Yungaqui Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SAN ISIDRO D. YUNGAQUI”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito D. Anta, perteneciente a la provincia D. Anta y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Florentina; ella es casada y tiene 55 años y tiene 6 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio D. venta D. queso, la socia prepara quesos y luego los venD. en forma independiente, ella lleva a las diferentes ferias que existe en Anta, la socia trabaja desD. las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, por medio D. este negocio la socia quiere sacara adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio D. venta D. quesos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para hacer los quesos como leche y sal al por mayor.
 
Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio D. crianza D. cuyes, negocio D. venta D. papa, negocio D. tienda D. abarrotes, negocio D. venta D. ganado, negocio D. venta D. maíz y negocio D. venta D. animales.
La socia que sale pegada a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues porque pidio permiso por motivos D. trabajo.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank SAN ISIDRO D. YUNGAQUI. This bank is located in the district of Anta, belonging to the province of Anta and the department of Cusco.

The member is Florentina. She is married, 55 years old, and has 6 children. She has a business selling cheese. She prepares cheeses and later sells them individually, taking them to different markets that take place in Anta. She works from 8:00AM until 5:00PM. Through her business the member wants her children to benefit. She wants to expand and to improve her business of selling cheeses. She is asking for this loan in order to buy supplies in order to make cheeses, such as milk and salt in bulk.

The other members are in businesses such as breeding guinea pigs, selling potatoes, grocery store, livestock, selling corn, and selling animals.

One member was attached to the photo after it was taken because she had work commitments. 

The member is grateful to those who are part of this dream through this loan and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as milk and salt in bulk in order to make cheese

loans.name: Sadaina

texts.en:
Sadaina lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has four children, three of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members, including her sisters. Sadaina has a business of a retail shop. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Sadaina sells her products in a shop, by means of retail.

Sadaina has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, and boxes of soap.

The main business challenges for Sadaina include seasonality, thieves, and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler and to build rental rooms. Sadaina lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include medication, rent, and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, and boxes of soap.

loans.name: Elenise

texts.es: Elenise, de 44 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora, carismática, con deseos de superación. Vive en su casa propia en compañía de su pareja, y de 4 hijos, asimismo a uno de sus nietos. El trabajo que realiza Elenise es la venta de ropa, de primera y segunda calidad, lo cual  realiza en el mercado de su ciudad, donde tiene todos los implementos necesarios. Tiene un año realizando esta actividad y durante este tiempo le valió para ganarse clientes a quienes atiende de manera amable. Para esto cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos mayores, que la ayudan en sus labores. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es que le permite tener un ingreso económico, que le permite pagar los gastos de su hogar. Su anhelo es ampliar su negocio y vender más productos para así poder incrementar sus ingresos. Esto sería el cuarto crédito con la institución MFP, se siente contenta y muy cómoda con el grupo al cual está integrada, pues considera que son personas responsables. Con el préstamo solicitado, comprará variedad de prendas, considera que a mayor variedad más acogida e ingresos tendrá su negocio.
texts.en:
Elenise, 44, is a charming, enterprising woman who wants to improve herself. She lives in her own house with her partner, her four children, and also one of her grandchildren. 

Elenise sells clothing, both first and second quality, in the city market, where she has all the necessary equipment. She has been doing this for a year, and during this time she has managed to win customers who she serves in a friendly way.  In this she has the support of her older children, who help her with her work. What she likes about her business, is that it provides her with an income that allows her to pay for her household expenses. 

She wishes to expand her business and sell more products, and so increase her income. This would be her fourth loan with MFP. She feels happy and very comfortable with the group she is a member of, as she considers them responsible people. 

With the loan she has applied for, she will buy a variety of clothing, as she considers that the more variety she has, the better received her business will be, and the more income she will have.

loans.use: To buy a variety of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Sechemin-Agontinkon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SECHEMIN-AGONTINKON est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Appoline Afiavi est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Appoline Afiavi est âgée de 48 ans, et est une veuve. Appoline Afiavi  a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Appoline Afiavi vit seule avec ses enfants. Appoline Afiavi a arrêté l’école au cours primaire. Depuis quinze ans, Appoline Afiavi vend des charbons de bois dans son quartier ; ce qui lui permet d’assurer ses diverses charges et ceux de ses enfants. Appoline Afiavi achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la troisième fois que Appoline Afiavi et les autres membres du groupement SECHEMIN-AGONTINKON sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur permettra de renforcer leur activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle. Les deux premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The SECHEMIN-AGONTINKON group is made up of three people who live in the same district.  The representative of the group, Appoline Afiavi, has her hand raised in the photo.  Appoline Afiavi is 48 years old and a widow. She has two children in her care, both of whom attend school.  Appoline Afiavi left school at the primary level. She has been selling charcoal for 15 years in her district, which allows her to meet her different needs and those of her children.   Appoline Afiavi buys her products at the market in Bénin.  This is the third time that she and the other members of the SECHEMIN-AGONTINKON group have requested a loan through ALIDé.  This loan will allow them to grow their businesses and be able to meet the demand of their customers.  The first two loans have been fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Mahouna3 Group

texts.fr: MAHOUNA3 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Viviane (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 51 ans et est mariée à un revendeur nommé Pascal. Le couple a trois enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Viviane vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Viviane n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Depuis cinq ans Viviane vend de la bouillie de maïs et des gâteaux (à base de farine de blé et du sucre) de façon ambulante, activité qu’elle exerce et qui lui procure des revenus non négligeables. Viviane achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Viviane et les autres membres du groupe MAHOUNA3 sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: MAHOUNA3 is a group of three people who all live in the same district.  The representative of the group, Viviane (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 51 years old and is married to a salesman named Pascal.  The couple has three children in their care, some of whom attend school.   Viviane lives with her husband and children. Together, the couple meets the different household needs.  Viviane did not attend school.   For five years, Viviane has been selling corn porridge and cakes (made from wheat flour and sugar ) on foot.  This work earns her a considerable income.  Vivian buys her products at the market in Bénin.   This is the second time that Viviane and the other members of the Mahouna3 group have requested financial help through ALIDé in order to increase their working capital and their work, and to meet the demands of their customers.  The first loan has been fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy sacks of corn, sugar, wheat flour and vegetable oil.

loans.name: Yeyimin Group

texts.fr: Le groupe YEYIMIN  est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier  au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Damienne, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la troisième  fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Damienne est âgée de 43 ans et est  mariée à un certain Abdoulaye. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Damienne vit ensemble avec son mari et enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Damienne a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Depuis une dizaine d’années, Damienne vend des fromages, de la farine de manioc, du maïs et du  riz. Ce qui lui permet de contribuer sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Damienne désire renforcer ses stocks de produits et rehausser le niveau de son activité. Pour ce faire, Damienne sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe YEYIMIN, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Yeyimin group is composed of 3 people who all live in the same district of Benin. They are requesting a loan from ALIDé so that they can invest in their businesses and raise their level of activity.

The group's representative, Damienne, is the woman in the picture with her hand raised. Damienne is 43 and is married to Abdoulaye. The couple live together with their 3 children, all of whom go to school, and they both share the household expenses. Damienne left school during her secondary education. For the past decade, she has been selling cheeses, manioc flour, corn and rice - the resulting income has allowed her to contribute to her family's needs without much difficulty.

Damienne would like to restock on goods and develop her business activities so that she can better respond to customer demand. It is for this reason that she and the Yeyimin group are requesting their third loan from ALIDé, having already fully repaid their first two loans.

loans.use: to restock on cheeses and bags of manioc flour, corn and rice.

loans.name: Rien N’Est Tard Group

texts.fr: Le groupe RIEN N’EST TARD est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Médékin est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Médékin est âgée de 58 ans, et est une veuve. Médékin a trois enfants, tous scolarisés dont un reste encore à sa charge. Médékin a arrêté l’école au cours primaire. Depuis huit ans, Médékin vend des yaourts, de la glace et des boissons locales dans son quartier; ce qui lui permet d’assurer ses diverses charges et ceux de son enfant. Parallèlement à cette activité, Médékin vend des céréales et des glacières par le système de distribution. Médékin achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin et dans un village du Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Médékin et les autres membres du groupement RIEN N’EST TARD sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur permettra de renforcer leur activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle. Le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The "Rien n'est tard" group (Nothing is late) consists of three persons who reside in the same neighborhood. Médékin, the representative of the group, is raising her hand in the photo.

Médékin is 58 years old and is a widow. She has three children, all of whom have attended school, and one is still a dependent. Médékin left school at primary level.

For the past eight years, Médékin has been selling yogurt, ice and local beverages in her neighborhood, which allows her to meet her own needs and those of her child. Alongside this activity, she sells grain cereals and coolers through the distribution system. Médékin gets her supplies from a market and also from a village, both located in Benin.

This is the second time Médékin and other members of the "Rien n'est tard" group have sought credit from ALIDé. This credit loan will allow them to strengthen their business to better meet the needs of their customers. The first loan was reimbursed in full.

loans.use: Buy drinks, cereals, ice coolers and milk.

loans.name: Reyna Yamilet

texts.es: Reyna está ensu último año de la carrera de química y farmacia, trabaja en un hospita en donde está poniendo en práctica los conocimientos adquiridos. El crédito solicitado será para pagar los módulos de titulación para ya finalizar su carrera. La inspiran a obtener un título sus hijos y su familia porque desea darles una mejor calidad de vida, tiene la iniciativa y los sueños de prosperar en la vida, espera poder trabajar como regente en una farmacia.
texts.en:
Reyna is in her last year of her program in chemistry and pharmacy.  She works in a hospital where she is applying the knowledge she has acquired.

The loan requested will be to pay for degree requirements to finish her academic program.

Her children and her family inspire her to get her degree because she wants to give them a better quality of life.  She has the initiative and the dreams to prosper in life.  She hopes to be able to work as a manager in a pharmacy.

loans.use: to pay for degree requirements.

loans.name: Montesiu Group

texts.es:
El grupo Montesisu está conformado por Martha, María, Cristian Isabel, Narcisa y Estebana cinco mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras. La coordinadora del grupo es Matha de 54 años quien hace 3 años tiene un negocio de tragamonedas  el cual lo inicio por ayuda de su hermano, además de eso vende gaseosas, cigarros y licor.

Mientras María vende prendas de oro, perfumes y juguetes, Cristian Isabel comercializa desde hace 5 años productos Avon, Narcisa desde hace 30 años se dedica a la costura  y Estebana es fotógrafa y vende cosméticos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Montesisu" is made up of 5 hardworking and enterprising women: Martha, Maria, Cristian Isabel, Narcisa and Estebana.  Martha, 54, is the coordinator of the group.  For 3 years, she has had a slot machine business which she started with the help of her brother.  In addition to this, she sells soft drinks, cigarettes and liquor.

Maria sells gold jewelry, perfumes and toys, Cristian Isabel has been selling Avon products for 5 years, Narcisa has been a dressmaker for 30 years, and Estebana is a photographer who sells cosmetics.

loans.use:
to buy soft drinks, cigarettes, and beer, and to make improvements 
to her machine

loans.name: Blanca Daisy

texts.es:
Blanca Daisy, tiene 47 años de edad, 25 años de casada, tienen 4 hijos de 17, 20, 22 y 24 años de edad, vive en la aldea Tulian Rio de Omoa Cortes.
Doña Blanca, una señora muy emprendedora, tiene un taller de ebanistería, donde elaboran muebles de madera como ser de  comedor, cocina, libreros, roperos etc. todo lo que le pidan sus clientes. Su esposo es ebanista y es quien hace los muebles y trabaja todos los días. Anteriormente era taller familiar y hace 6 años que es propio. Trabajan en base a pedidos y venta de contado.
Para generar otros ingresos ella elabora y vende pan todos los días. 
Con ODEF a recibido ocho prestamos para invertir en madera e insumos para los muebles y deja una parte para los insumos que ocupa para hacer pan.
De esta manera ha mejorado su calidad de vida en la familia y a mantenido su negocio.
texts.en:
Blanca Daisy is 47 years old and has been married for 25 years. She has four children (ages 17, 20, 22, and 24). They live in the neighborhood of Tulian Rio in Omoa Cortes.

Doña Blanca is a very enterprising woman who manages a woodworking shop where she and her husband produce furniture such as dining sets, cooktops, bookcases, wardrobes, and other pieces. Everything they make is based on orders from their customers. Her husband is a woodworker and works every day to produce the furniture. This business previously belonged to a relative and they took over six years ago. Their work is driven by orders and their products are sold for cash. To generate extra income, Blanca makes and sells bread every day.

Blanca has received eight loans to invest in the purchase of wood and supplies for making furniture. Part of the money was used to buy supplies for making bread. Working in this manner has improved the quality of life of her family and has helped to maintain her business.

loans.use: to buy wood and other supplies for making furniture.

loans.name: Jesukpego-Zogbo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe JESUKPEGO-ZOGBO est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Kouèba Marguérite est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Kouèba Marguérite est âgée de 56 ans, et est mariée à un transitaire du nom de Jean. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés dont trois restent encore à sa charge. Kouèba Marguérite n’ a pas fréquenté l’école. Depuis une dizaine d’années, Kouèba Marguérite vend du maïs, de la farine de blé, et de la farine de manioc par le système de distribution. Parallèlement à cette activité, Kouèba Marguérite vend des boissons locales. Ce qui lui permet de contribuer aux diverses charges de la famille. Kouèba Marguérite achète ses produits au Nigéria et dans un village du Bénin. C’est la troisième fois que Kouèba Marguérite et les autres membres du groupe JESUKPEGO-ZOGBO sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur permettra de renforcer leur activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle. Les deux premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Jesukpego-Zogbo group consists of three persons who reside in the same neighborhood. Kouèba Marguerite is the representative for the group, and is raising her hand in the photo.

She is 56 years old and is married to a forwarding agent named John. The couple has five children, all of whom attend (or have attended) school, and three of them are still dependents. Kouèba Marguérite has not attended school herself.

For the past ten years, Kouèba Marguérite has been selling corn, wheat flour and cassava flour through the distribution system. Alongside this activity, she also sells local beverages. This allows her to contribute towards the various family expenses. She gets her supplies from Nigeria and also from a village in Benin.

This is the third time Kouèba Marguérite and other members of the Jesukpego-Zogbo group have sought a credit loan from ALIDé. This loan will allow them to strengthen their business to better meet the needs of their customers. The first two loans have been fully reimbursed.

loans.use: Buy bags of corn, wheat flour, cassava flour and local beverages

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To pay educational fees for his children and purchase household and construction materials

loans.name: Nazareno Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Nazareno lo conforman Yudith, Jesenia y María Auxiliadora; tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Yudith de 21 años quien es comerciante de ropa. Este negocio lo aprendió con su mamá  quien se dedicaba a la venta de ropa y luego ella se independizó.
Ella está casada y espera a su primer hijo el cual nacerá el próximo mes. 

Las otras integrantes son Jesenia de 24 años quien vende ropa y productos de belleza, y María Auxiliadora de 62 años quien de lunes a viernes vende gaseosas y golosinas y los fines de semana vende ropa en los balnearios cercanos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "El Nazareno" is made up of three hardworking and enterprising women: Yudith, Jesenia and María Auxiliadora.  Yudith, 21, is the coordinator of the group, and she has a business selling clothing.  She learned this trade from her mother, who also used to sell clothing.  Later Yudith started to work independently.

Yudith is married and is expecting her first child next month.

The other members of the group are Jesenia, 24, who sells clothing and beauty products, and Maria Auxiliadora, 62, who sells soft drinks and candy during the weekdays and sells clothing on the weekends at nearby resorts.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Nery

texts.es: Nery, de 37 años, es una mujer entusiasta y emprendedora. Vive en compañía de su pareja y de sus tres hijos de 14, 6 y 4 años en su casa propia, que logró construir con el apoyo de su pareja. El trabajo que realiza Nery es la producción y venta de carbón, lo cual realiza en un lugar alejado de la zona industrial de su ciudad, siendo un lugar apropiado y así evita la contaminación. Produce 150 sacos de carbón cada quince días, ésta actividad viene realizando hace 10 años, para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda de 2 peones para la elaboración del carbón y les paga por día trabajado. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le trae un buen ingreso económico, para que pueda mantener la economía de su casa y así sacar adelante a sus hijos. Considera rentable el trabajo realizado porque sus productos tienen mucha demanda. Lo que no le gusta es que pesado, pero eso no le quita las ganas de seguir trabajando. nos comenta que tiene deseos de crecer cada día más. Esto sería el cuarto crédito con la MFP, se siente contenta de formar parte de un grupo con personas puntuales en el pago, que la anima a seguir en el grupo. Con el préstamo solicitado, comprará leña, madera rezagada en mayor cantidad para la elaboración del carbón.
texts.en:
37-year old Nery is an enthusiastic, enterprising woman. She lives with her husband and three children aged 14, 6, and 4 in her own house which she and her husband built. 

Nery makes and sells charcoal in a place far from the industrial zone of the town. It’s a suitable location as it avoids polluting the nearby area. She makes 150 bags of charcoal every two weeks, a job she’s been doing for ten years. She has help from two labourers and pays them on a daily basis. Nery likes the work as she earns a good living from it, supporting her household and helping her children get ahead. The business is profitable as there is a big demand for charcoal. It’s hard work, for sure, but she has no intention of quitting work. On the contrary, she wishes to expand the business.

This will be Nery’s fourth loan with MFP. She feels very happy to be part of a group of people who make their repayments on time and encourage her to continue with the group. With the loan she will buy scrap wood in large quantities to make charcoal.

loans.use: to buy wood

loans.name: Restauración Group

texts.es:
El grupo Restauración lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Liliam de Fátima Artola quien se dedica al comercio de ropa y perfumes desde hace 10 años. Ella con el crédito comprara pacas de ropa y mercadería en perfumes aprovechando la temporada. 
Las otras integrantes son Justina de 54 años quien vende granos básicos e Isabel de 33 años tiene una pequeña y modesta pulpería.
texts.en:
Three hard-working and enterprising people make up the Restauración group.  One of them is Liliam de Fátima Artola, who has worked for 10 years  selling clothing and perfume.  With the loan she will buy bales of clothes and perfume merchandise to take advantage of the season.

The other members are Justina, 54, who sells staple foods, and Isabel, 33, who has a small and modest store.

loans.use: to buy bales of clothes and perfume.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine, who lives in Kampala, Uganda, is a married mother of four children, two of whom attend school. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses are school fees and medication.

Josephine has operated a retail shop, open seven days a week, for the last 10 years. She is now requesting a loan of 500000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more sugar, cooking oil, boxes of soap, flour and rice. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality, and her goals are to expand into a wholesale shop and to educate her children to university level.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, boxes of soap, rice, cooking oil  and maize flour.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es: Guillermina, de 60 años, es una mujer entusiasta y dinámica. Esta casada y es madre de cuatro hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia. El trabajo que realiza Guillermina consiste en la venta de comida, la cual está instalada en el mercado de su ciudad. Actividad que viene realiando desde hace nueve años, tiempo que le valió ser conocida en la zona logrando captar clientela. En este trabajo cuenta con el apoyo de su hijo para la atención al público. Lo que le gusta es que le permite tener un ingreso económico, y con ello pagar los gastos de su casa, además de  socializarse con las personas. Sin embargo, es hay veces que los precios de los productos para la elaboración de comidas no tienen un precio estable. Su anhelo es seguir creciendo, y así, tener su propio restaurante. Esto será el cuarto crédito con MFP, con el grupo que trabaja se siente cómoda porque son personas responsables y espera poder seguir bien y continuar trabajando con la institución. Con el préstamo solicitado, comprará productos al por mayor tales como arroz, aceites y otros. Además de utensilios para implementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Guillermina, 60, is an enthusiastic and dynamic woman.  She is married and the mother of four children.  Together they live in her own home.

Guillermina's job consists of selling food, which is located in the market in her city.  She has been doing this job for nine years, time that has allowed her to become known in the area, managing to attract customers.  She has the help of her son to serve the public.

What she likes is that it allows her to have an economic income with which to pay the household expenses as well as to socialize with people.  Nevertheless, there are times that the prices of the ingredients for making dishes don't have a stable price.  Her wish is to continue growing and so have her own restaurant.

This will be her fourth loan with MFP.  She feels comfortable with the group she works with because they are responsible people, and she hopes to continue doing well and continue working with the institution.

With the loan requested she will buy products wholesale, such as rice, oils, and others, as well as utensils to implement her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, and utensils.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children, of whom only two go to school. She takes care of additional family members, including her grandchildren. She sells fired cassava (a root similar to a potato) and pancakes on a retail basis. She works six days a week. She has been in business for the last three years.

Jane has requested a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO to buy baking flour and cooking oil. Her major business challenge is transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to own a fully established bakery and also to buy a plot of land. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses are utility bills, rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more baking flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Linda Group

texts.es:
El grupo Linda lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras  una de ellas es la señora Rosa quien trabaja como doméstica y tiene un pequeño negocio de comercio de ropa y artículos de televisión como controles, antenas…etc. Ella tiene 7 hijos de los cuales 4 viven con ella de 25, 20, 12 y 8 años los menores estudian y los dos mayores le ayudan en el negocio. 
Las otras integrantes son Marcia de 38 años quien tiene una pulpería desde hace 5 años y Maricela de 23 años desde hace 2 años se dedica a la costura con el propósito de sacar a su hijo de 4 años adelante.
texts.en:
The Linda Group is made up of three hardworking and enterprising women.  One of them is Rosa, who works as a housekeeper and has a small business selling clothing and television accessories, such as remote controls, antennas, etc.  She has seven children, four of whom live with her.  They are 25, 20, 12, and 8 years old and the younger ones go to school while the two older ones help her with her business.

The other members are Marcia, who is 38 and has had a small grocery store for 5 years, and Maricela, who is 23 and has been sewing for a living for two years in order to get her four children ahead.

loans.use: to buy clothing and television accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy galvanized corrugated iron and doors for the completion of a family house he has begun

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has five children, all of whom are in school. She also helps care for her brother and sister. For the last seven years, Ruth has earned a living by going door-to-door to sell second-hand clothes. She is applying for a loan for 400,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more clothing to sell to her customers. Her main challenges are transportation and the seasonal nature of her business. Her goals for the future are to rent a shop where she can sell her clothes and to become a wholesaler. She lives in her own house where her family has access to electricity and piped-in water. Her major monthly expenses are feeding her family and paying her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more second-hand clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Cristhian Maricela

texts.es:
La señora Cristhian Marisela es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora de 25 años. Ella hace 2 años empezó su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, plata y cosméticos  el cual poco a poco ha ido creciendo.
Ella invertirá el crédito en mercadería para aprovechar la temporada de diciembre.
texts.en:
Cristhian Marisela is a hardworking and enterprising 25-year-old woman.  Two years ago she started her small business selling clothing, silver, and cosmetics, which has been growing little by little. 

She will use the loan to buy merchandise to take advantage of the season of December.

loans.use: to buy clothing, silver, and cosmetic merchandise

loans.name: Marta Lorena

texts.es:
La señora Marta Lorena es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien tiene una pulpería desde hace 3 años. Este negocio lo inicio vendiendo helados, hielos y repostería luego con el tiempo y los prestamos fue aumentando.
Ella invertirá el crédito en productos en especial granos básicos. Marta tiene cuatro hijos de 23, 22, 15 y 14 los cuales estudian y le ayudan en el negocio.
texts.en:
Marta Lorena is a hardworking and enterprising woman who has had a small grocery store for three years now.  She started this business selling ice cream, Popsicles, and pastries.  With time and loans she started expanding it.

She will invest the loan in products, particularly staple grains.  Marta has four children who are 23, 22, 15, and 14 who go to school and help her with her business.

loans.use: to buy staple grains and products to stock up for sales

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema  lives in Kampala, Uganda with her husband and two children, both of whom attend school. She also helps care for two other family members, her niece and nephew. For the last three years, she has worked for seven days a week to earn a living by selling chapatti (a type of flatbread) in a local market. She is applying for a loan  for 400,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more flour and cooking oil. Her major business challenges are transportation, the rising price of ingredients and the seasonal nature of her business. Her goals for the future is to go into a wholesale business. She lives in a rented house where her family has access to electricity but not piped-in water. Her major monthly expenses are school fees and medical care.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make flatbread.

loans.name: Gbenan Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GBENAN est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier  au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Sidonie, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Sidonie est âgée de 37 ans et est  mariée à un conducteur du nom de Edmond. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Sidonie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Sidonie n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Depuis neuf ans, Sidonie vend des charbons de bois et des plateaux d’œufs. Ce qui lui permet de contribuer sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Sidonie désire renforcer ses stocks de produits et rehausser le niveau de son activité. Pour ce faire, Sidonie sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GBENAN, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The GBENAN group is made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood in Benin. The group's leader, Sidonie, has her hand raised in the photo.
This is the first time that the group has asked for financial help from ALIDé in order to increase the level of their activity. 

Sidonie is 37 years old and married to a driver named Edmond. The couple has 2 children, both of them are in their care and go to school. Sidonie lives with her husband and children. Together, the couple takes care of the various household expenses. Sidonie did not go to school. For the past nine years, she has been selling charcoal and trays of eggs. This allows her to easily contribute to her family's needs. In an effort to better meet her customers' demand, Sidonie wants to increase her stock and boost the level of her activity. To do this, she is requesting, along with the other members of the GBENAN group, her first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal and trays of eggs.

loans.name: Silvia De Fatima

texts.es:
La señora Silvia es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien inicio su venta hace 10 años con la venta de meneítos, tortillitas, quesitos…etc. luego con el tiempo y los prestamos fue aumentando su negocio surtiéndolo con productos como granos básicos.
Ella con el crédito comprara productos como granos básicos, productos de limpieza…etc. y juguetes. El sueño de Silvia es tener una cristalería.
texts.en:
Silvia is a hardworking and enterprising woman who started her business 10 years ago selling chips, tortillas, cheese, etc.  With time and loans she began expanding her business, supplying it with products such as staple grains.

With the loan she will buy products such as staple grains, cleaning products, toys, etc.  Silvia's dream is to have a glassware shop.

loans.use: to buy staple grains and other products for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay school fees for his children and items for his house.

loans.name: Mahougnon Group

texts.fr: MAHOUGNON est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres habitent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Eudoxie Marie (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 48 ans et est mariée à un transitaire du nom de Magloire. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Eudoxie Marie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Eudoxie Marie a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire. Depuis cinq ans Eudoxie Marie vend des charbons de bois et du riz, activité qu’elle exerce et qui lui procure des revenus non négligeables dans son quartier. Eudoxie Marie achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la troisième  fois que Eudoxie Marie et les autres membres du groupe MAHOUGNON  sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en: MAHOUGNON is a group made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood. The group's leader, Eudoxie Marie, (hand raised in the photo), is 47 years old and married to a freight agent named Magloire. The couple has 2 children, both of them are in their care and go to school. Eudoxie Marie lives with her husband and children. Together, the couple takes care of the various household expenses. Eudoxie Marie left school at the secondary level. For the past five years, she has been selling charcoal and rice, a business that allows here to earn a decent living in her neighborhood. She buys her products at a market in Benin. This is the third time that Eudoxie Marie and the other members of MAHOUGNON have asked for financial support from ALIDé in order to increase their working capital and their business, and to better meet their customers' demand.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice and charcoal.

loans.name: Midedji Group

texts.fr: MIDEDJI est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Solange (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 43 ans et est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Simplice. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Solange vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Solange a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire. Depuis une quinzaine d’années, Solange vend de l’avocat, de l’igname et des chaussures de façon ambulante. Solange achète ses produits dans un marché du Togo et dans un village du Bénin. C’est la quatrième fois que Solange et les autres membres du groupe MIDEDJI sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Les trois premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
MIDEDJI Group is made up of three persons who live in the same neighborhood. The group's representative, named Solange (raising her hand in the photograph) is 43 years old and married to a mechanic named Simplice. The couple has two school-attending children they have to support.

Solange lives together with her husband and children. The couple takes care of the various household expenses together. Solange dropped out of middle school. For about 15 years, she's been selling avocados, yams, and shoes as a traveling saleswoman.

She gets her supplies in a market in Togo and in a village in Benin. For the fourth time, Solange and the other members of the group are seeking financial support from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, in order to bolster their working capital and better meet customer demand.

The first three loans were repaid without problems.

loans.use: to buy shoes, yams, and fruits (avocados)

loans.name: María De Jesús

texts.es:
La señora María de Jesús de 48 años es una fémina trabajadora y emprendedora. Ella inicio su pequeña venta con el comercio de chiverías y dulces (ranchitas, tortillitas, bombones, chicles, papas, paletas, gomas…etc.) poco a poco fue invirtiendo en otros productos como huevos, pan, queso, fósforos, champú...etc.
En la actualidad tiene su negocio surtido con variedad de productos y el crédito lo invertirá en granos básicos, cosméticos y verduras…etc.
texts.en:
María de Jesús is 48 years old and is a hardworking and enterprising woman.  Shes started her small business selling dairy products and candy (tortilla chips, candy, chewing gum, potato chips, Popsicles, bubble gum, etc.).  Little by little she began investing in other products such as eggs, bread, cheese, matches, shampoo, etc.  

Currently, her business is stocked with a variety of products and she will use the loan to buy staple grains, cosmetics, vegetables, etc.

loans.use: to buy staple grains, cosmetics, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Felictus

texts.en: Felictus lives in Kampala, Uganda with her five children, two of whom are currently enrolled in school. She also helps support one other member of her family. She works seven days a week at two jobs: selling bananas and cleaning the facilities of the Kampala City Council. She is applying for a loan for 300,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more bananas to sell to her customers. Her main business challenges are the high cost of transportation and the seasonal nature of her work. Her goal for the future is to help improve her family's living standards. She lives in her own house but does not have access to electricity or piped-in water. Her major monthly expenses are school fees and providing food for her family.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en: Salma lives in the coastal town of Mombasa, Kenya. She is married and has five children, all of whom are in school. She earns a living by selling hardware and building supplies such as cement, wood and pipes. She also earns money on the side selling fresh juice. She is applying for a loan for Ksh 80,000 to buy a motorcycle. Her goals are to earn enough money to pay her children's school fees, meet her family's other basic needs and hire an employee to help her with her work.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is widowed and has five children who attend school.  She lives in Kampala, Uganda in a rented house with access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses are school fees, rent, and food.

Joyce sells charcoal on retail basis at the market, which she has been doing for 10 years.  She works seven days a week. 

Joyce is requesting a loan for 200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. Her major business challenges are thieves and seasonality. Her goal is to become a wholesaler and to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Mahougnon Evivi Group

texts.fr: MAHOUGNON EVIVI est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Hélène (dont la main est levée sur la photo) est mariée à un certain Comlan. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Hélène vit ensemble avec son mari et ses  enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Hélène a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges,  Hélène vend depuis cinq ans, des vêtements de façon ambulante. Hélène s’approvisionne au Togo. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d'élargir son activité,  Hélène sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHOUGNON EVIVI. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
The MAHOUGNON EVIVI  group is made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood in Benin. The group's leader, Hélène (hand raised in the photo), is married to a man named Colman. The couple has two children, both of whom go to school and are in the care of their parents. Hélène lives with her husband and children. Together, the couple takes care of the various household needs. 

Hélène left school at the secondary level. To meet her expenses, for the last 5 years Hélène has been selling clothes on foot. She obtains her supplies in Togo. 

With the goal of meeting customer demand and expanding her business, Hélène, along with the other members of MAHOUGNON EVIVI,  is asking for a third loan from ALIDé. This loan will allow them to better meet their customers' needs and make more profit.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Nonvignon Gbedjromede Group

texts.fr: Le groupe NONVIGNON GBEDJROMEDE est formé de trois  personnes qui vivent dans la même zone. La représentante  de ce groupe, nommé Eulalie, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Eulalie est âgée de 38 ans et est mariée à un transitaire du nom de Dorothé. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Eulalie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple se partage les diverses charges de la famille. Eulalie n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Depuis sept ans, Eulalie vend de divers articles (conserves, savons, insecticides) dans son quartier. Parallèlement à cette activité, Eulalie vend des produits alimentaires (condiments, céréales, et de l’huile). Dans le souci de renforcer davantage son activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Eulalie  sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe NONVIGNON GBEDJROMEDE, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group NONVIGNON GBEDJROMEDE is comprised of three persons who live in the same area. The group's representative, by the name of Eulalie, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. This is the third time this group has requested financial support from ALIDé with the aim of boosting their business. 

Eulalie is 38 years old and married to a shipping agent by the name of Dorothé. They have five children, all in school and in their care. She lives together with her husband and children. The couple shares in meeting family expenses. 

Eulalie did not go to school. For seven years, she has been selling a variety of goods (canned food, soaps, insecticides) in her district. Concurrent to this business, she sells staple goods (condiments, grains, and oil). 

Concerned about bolstering her business further and responding better to customer requirements, Eulalie along with the other members of the group NONVIGNON GBEDJROMEDE are requesting a third loan from ALIDé. The first two loans have indeed been repaid.
