texts.en:
Maria Herminia is a widow. She is 52 years old and is an elementary school teacher. She has two children, who are students. She has been a teacher for several years.

She is asking for a loan in order to purchase products for her store. She sells consumer goods. She will use the money to purchase products such as soft drinks, juices, sweets, sugar, etc. She hopes her business will have a prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase products for her store

loans.name: Regina Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Regina Isabel es casada, tiene 27 años de edad, cursó los 3 años de educación básica, tiene 2 hijos los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la tejeduría de cortes típicos, inicio este trabajo con su señor padre, lleva 10 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es profesor de educación física.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de hilos de diferente clases y colores para poder producir corte típicos y poder mejorar su negocio, espera en el futuro ver su negocio grande.
texts.en:
Regina Isabel is a 27-year-old married woman who completed three years of elementary school study. She has two children who are studying. She works weaving traditional clothes. She started the business with her father and now has 10 years of experience. She also has her husband's support, who works as a physical education teacher. 

She is requesting a loan to buy different kinds of colored threads in order to make traditional clothing and be able to improve her business. She hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy thread to make traditional clothing.

loans.name: Josefa Antonia

texts.es: Josefa mujer humilde, trabaja como docente en un colegio público, casada, junto a su esposo tiene el proyecto de mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda. Para ofrecerle a su familia seguridad. Con el préstamo comprar materiales de construcción como. Cemento, arena, piedrines, estribus, alambre de amarre, hierro, bloques, tablones de madera, clavos entre otros materiales para la construcción de una pared del lado derecho delantero de la vivienda, siendo de necesidad ya que actualmente es alambre y laminas de zinc viejos. Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo al mejoramiento del nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Josefa is a humble woman who works as a public school teacher. She is married. Along with her husband, she has the goal of improving their household infrastructure, thus offering safety to their family. 

Josefa is asking for a loan to purchase construction materials such as concrete, sand, gravel, supports, tie wire, iron, cinder blocks, wood planks and nails (among others), needed for building a wall on the front-right side of their house. It is a necessity, considering that this space is currently covered with old sheet metal and wires. She is thankful to the microfinance institution for the support she has received in order to improve the quality of her life.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Javier Wilfredo

texts.es: El cliente comenzó siendo solo chofer de un vehículo al que le entregaba renta, ahorro poco a poco y con la ayuda de las financieras se compro su auto con el trabaja actualmente, su esposa se dedica a la servicio de comidas rápida, ambos cuentan con solvencia y ganas de desarrollarse en sus actividades como en su familia. Ahora su hija menor esta con problemas de salud y la madre la esta atendiendo la hija aparte de estar embarazada, tiene retraso mental, ella tiene 16 años, y por el problema de retraso mental tiene el carácter de un niño de 4 años, pese así enfermedad los padres sobrellevan junto a su hija la cotidianidad del día a día para ellos tener una actividad se torna en una distracción con el esfuerzo de la crianza de su hija, pero de todas formas le tienen un gran afecto y siempre le están ayudando en sus quehaceres. La ayuda que significara el préstamo Kiva hará efecto en toda la familia ya que se verán aliviados apaliando los gastos en los que incurran en la intervención de su hija y asi la famlia estara mejor.
texts.en:
Javier started out working as a driver with a rented car. Little by little, he saved some money and, with the help of the microfinance institution, was able to buy a car which he now uses at work. His wife works selling fast food. Both are solvent and want to make progress in their businesses, as well as growing as a family.

Now, their youngest daughter is having some health problems. His wife is taking care of their daughter who, apart from being pregnant, is developmentally disabled. Their daughter is 16 years old, and, due to her disability, acts like a 4-year-old. Despite her disability, their parents live a normal day-to-day life. Having a business is a distraction from the hard work they do raising their daughter. No matter what, they love her very much and they are always helping her out. 

This loan would relieve the whole family since it will be used to cover some costs of their daughter's care. The family will feel better.

loans.use: To buy medicine for his daughter.

loans.name: Guillermo Elezar

texts.es: Guillermo de 38 se dedica a la reparación de automóviles y tiene su propio negocio de taller Mecánico desde hace 8 años donde él desempeña el oficio de mecánico automotriz. Desde que inicio su negocio ha sido su única fuente de ingresos con los que ha sostenido los gastos del hogar, aunque se separo de su esposa, el sigue dando manutención a 3 sus pequeños de los cuales quiere ofrecer un buen estudio y una mejor calidad de vida aunque el no esté con ellos por situación ajenas a él. En este momento el quiere cambiar el techo de su negocio porque ya esta deteriorado; en temporadas de lluvia el agua se trasmina y no quiere que su maquinaria y equipo del negocio se descomponga lo cual sería un gasto mayor. Para comenzar el cambio de techo necesita comprar lamina, clavos, madera y pgar a la persona que le realizara el trabajo.
texts.en:
Guillermo is 38 years old and makes a living repairing automobiles. He has his own mechanic shop for 8 years, where he works as an automotive mechanic. 

Since he started his business, it has been his only source of income which he uses to pay family expenses. Although he is separated from his wife, he still provides child support for his 3 children, for whom he wants to offer a good education and a better quality of life, despite the fact that he cannot be with them due to circumstances beyond his control. 

Now he wants to replace the damaged roof of his business because it is deteriorating. During the rainy season the roof leaks and he wants to prevent all his machinery and equipment from being damaged, which would mean incurring greater expenses. To start the roof replacement he needs to buy sheet metal, nails and wood, and pay for someone to do the job.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal, nails and wood to replace the roof of his business.

loans.name: Carmen Pastora

texts.es:
Carmen mujer trabajadora, tienes su propio negocio, con el préstamo anterior abasteció su venta con mayores cantidades y variedad de productos así también le realizo mejoras al cuarto colocándole cerámica. Los planes a corto plazo es mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda. Se le presento dificultares ya que su hijo se enfermo teniendo que invertir en la compra de médicos.
Con el préstamo que solicitad lo invertirá en la compra de materiales de construcción: Cemento, arena, piedrines, estribus, alambre de amarre, hierro, bloques, tablones de madera, clavos entre otros materiales para la construcción del muro trasero de su casa.  Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo constante al mejoramiento de su nivel de vida ya que obtendrá mayor comodidad y seguridad para su familia.
texts.en:
Carmen is an industrious woman who has her own business. She used her previous loan to increase her sales with a greater number and variety of products. She also made improvements to the room by putting in tile. 

Her short-term plan is to improve the infrastructure of her house. She encountered some problems in doing this because her child got sick and she had to use her money to pay for doctors' expenses. She will use the requested loan to buy construction materials such as: cement, sand, gravel, supports, tie wire, iron, cinder blocks, wooden boards, nails and other materials needed for the construction of the wall in the back of her house. 

She is thankful to this finance institution for providing consistent support for her to improve her quality of life, as this loan will help her with providing her family with increased comfort and security.

loans.use: to build a wall for her house.

loans.name: Sanu

texts.en:
Sanu  is 36 years old.  She is married and has three children aged 18, 12 and 6.  In 2002, she established  her tea shop business.  Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy foods for her business.  

In the future, Sanu  plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

Whether on the streets of Kathmandu or in the villages outside of the capital, tea shops are places of business and meeting in Nepal.  Called "chiya pasal", these tea shops make a sweet, milky tea that can be purchased for a few cents a cup.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to keep their store shelves stocked while increasing their profit margins by buying in greater volume.

loans.use: to buy foods for her tea shop business.

loans.name: Rajani

texts.en:
Rajani is 25 years old.  She is married and has one child, aged 4.  In 2000, she established  her meat shop business.  Working 7 days a week and 5 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy goats and chickens for her business.  In the future, Rajani plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.   

In Nepal, the meat is always fresh.  In small stalls along busy roads, open air butcher shops sell chicken, goat, and water buffalo by the kilo.  The stalls are piled high with products and sales are brisk.  With the help of a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase additional stock at better prices.  This increase in purchasing volume creates greater profit margins for the borrower.

loans.use: to buy chickens and goats.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is married with five healthy adult-aged children. She is 45 years of age and resides at San Vicente, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. 

Francisca is in agriculture, planting and harvesting rice to earn a living. Rice nowadays will not grow well without fertilizer and pesticides that are needed to kill the insects that will harm the rice. She has been in this business for about ten years and the income generated every month doing this type of activity is 14,762 PHP.

Francisca joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative to request funds to purchase fertilizers. She is requesting a loan in the amount of Php 30,000. This money is intend to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies. In the future, she plans to add another rice field to increase her income.

loans.use: Purchase rice fertilizers for good growth.

location.town: San Vicente, Tambulig Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Laxmi is 33 years old, married, and has three children aged 13, 6, and 1.  In 2001, she established  her meat shop business.  Working seven days a week and five hours a day, Laxmi supports her family.  

Laxmi has received and repaid four loans from Patan BPW.  She is requesting a fifith loan, which she will use to buys goats and chickens for her business.  In the future, Laxmi plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.   

In Nepal, the meat is always fresh.  In small stalls along busy roads, open air butcher shops sell chickens, goats, and water buffalo by the kilo.  The stalls are piled high with products and sales are brisk.  With the help of a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase additional stock at better prices.  This increase in purchasing volume creates greater profit margins for the borrower.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and goats.

loans.name: Jeremias

texts.en:
Jeremias is from the village of La Victoria Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. He is married and has three children. He is 32 years old. 
To earn a living, Jeremias owns and operates a business in the retail sector selling used shoes in the community. He discovered this kind of business through his friend. He found out that this line of business is in demand in the town. Without a doubt, he engaged in this line of business and has been in business for two years. 

He has a stall in the public mall of his town where in he regularly displays his products. He earns around 6,100 PHP a month from these activities. Anywhere you go in the Philippines there are second-hand clothes called "Okay-Okay" and this is the line of business he is engaged in.

In 2011, Jeremias joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Jeremias is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional used shoes "okay-okay" to sell.  He will invest the funds to expand his business.

This loan will be the second loan taken out by  Jeremias from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: purchase additional used shoes "okay-okay" to sell.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is from the village of Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 34 years old, married, and has three children. 

To make a living, he owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. Jimmy has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

Early in 2011, Jimmy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his ability to engage in business activities. Jimmy is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase feed and other supplies for the fast growth of his pigs.This loan will be the first taken out by Jimmy from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to invest back into the business to double his profits.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies for pigs' growth.

loans.name: Agapita

texts.en:
Agapita is 54 years of age. She is married and blessed with three children. She lives in Aurora Zamboanga del Sur. Her husband is a farmer helping her to earn a living.

Agapita owns and operates a business venture in the food sector. The primary activity is selling her cooked products like cooked peanuts, cassava flakes, and banana chips to earn a living. Agapita’s main source of income is from selling these kinds of foods. She has been in this business for over five years and earns PHP 4,000 per month.

She has been a member of GDMPC since early this year. She joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to better her business investment. Agapita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase raw materials for her homemade products. 

In the future, Agapita wants to save the income generated for the education of her children. She plans to engage in another line of business to double or triple her income to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her homemade products.

location.town: Bagong Lipunan, Aurora Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Pramila

texts.en:
Pramila is 30 years old.  She is married and has one child, aged 10.  In 1998, she established her vegetable farming business.  Working seven days a week and five hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan Business and Professional Women, and wants to use this new loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.  In the future, Pramila plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

 Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural.  Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land.  Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market.  Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Rama

texts.en:
Rama is 45 years old. She is married and has three children aged 22, 15, and 9. In 2003, she established her cow-raising business. Working seven days per week and five hours per day, she supports her family. 
 
She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy a young milk-giving cow.  In the future, Rama plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal.  Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made.  Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking.  On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day.  In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50.  In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and can be used to capture methane in storage tanks. 
 
The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

loans.use: to buy a young cow.

loans.name: Shova

texts.en:
Shova is 38 years old. She is married and has two children, aged 17 and 14. In 2001, she established her grocery store business. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family. 
 
She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy grocery goods for her business.  In the future, Shova plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.  

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called pasal, are an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma, a 33-year-old married mother of three children, lives in the Philippines where she has a shop that sells vegetables such as squash, eggplants and string beans. In business for five years and a member of HSPFI since 2010, Gemma is requesting a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy more stocks of vegetables to sell. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Melodina

texts.en: Melodina, a 28-year-old married mother of one child, lives in the Philippines where for the past five years she has operated a shop that makes wood and coconut charcoal to sell by the sack. A member of HSPFI since 2010, she is requesting a loan for PHP 12,000 to buy wood and coconut shells to make more charcoal. In the future, Melodina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy wood & coconut shells for making charcoal.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 44-years-old . She is married with 5 children. 

Wilma has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & shampoo. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy shampoo, beverages, noodles & candies for selling.

Wilma has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Wilma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, beverages, noodles & candies for selling.

Rosalina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rosalina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Amor has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Amor hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing, curtains & bed sheets for selling.

Emma has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Emma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, detergents & beverages for selling.

Jocelyn is peddling clothing like t-shirts, blouses & underwear. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy stocks of clothing to sell.

Jocelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jocelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Nena

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn is 36-years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

Emelyn has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, breads & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, breads & beverages.

Emelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Emelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, breads & beverages.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

Jocelyn has a food shop or carenderia that sells viands like chicken & pork adobo, halang-halang & bulalo. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands.

Jocelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jocelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Evelyn has a shop that sells spices, food seasonings, snacks and coconut wines. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy spices, food seasonings and snacks.

Evelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Evelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy spices, food seasonings and snacks

loans.name: Dioleta

texts.en:
Dioleta is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 

Dioleta has a food shop or carenderia that sells viands like caldereta, afritada and also groceries like coffee and milk powder. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands and groceries for the store.

Dioleta has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Dioleta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands and groceries for the store

loans.name: Charlo

texts.en:
Charlo is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married. 

Charlo is providing motorcycle or habal-habal services. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan for 9,000 PHP to buy tools for maintenance and pay for the gasoline.

Charlo has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Charlo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools for maintenance and pay for the gasoline

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 

Vivian is making and peddling viands like fried fish, ginataang langka and atsara. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 9,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands.

Vivian has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Vivian hopes to improve her business.

texts.en:
Victor is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is widowed with 9 children. 

Victor has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan for 9,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Victor has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Victor hopes to improve his business.

Revilita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Revilita hopes to improve her business.

loans.name: Rechel

texts.en:
Rechel is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 

Rechel has a food shop that sells viands like caldereta and afritada. She also has a retail store that sells biscuits and snacks. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 9,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands and groceries for the store.

Rechel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rechel hopes to improve her business.

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 

Elizabeth has a shop that sells canned goods, shampoo, detergents and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 9,000 PHP to buy canned goods, shampoo, detergents and beverages .

Elizabeth has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Elizabeth hopes to improve her business.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 61 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 

Lolita has a shop that sells canned goods, soaps and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and soaps.

Lolita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Lolita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and soaps

loans.name: Francis Elaine

texts.en:
Francis Elaine is 19 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. She has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 1 year. She requested a loan for 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy additional stock of canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

Francis Elaine has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Francis Elaine hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 12 children.

Ofelia has a shop that sells candies, snacks, beverages, and breads. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan of 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy more candies, snacks, and beverages to sell.

Ofelia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Ofelia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy candies, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Edetha

texts.en:
Edetha is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.

Edetha has a shop that sells canned goods, eggs, coffee powder, and noodles. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy more stock of eggs, coffee powder, noodles, and canned goods to sell.

Edetha has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Edetha hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy eggs, coffee powder, noodles, and canned goods to sell.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is 48 years old and lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She is widowed and has 2 children, one son and one daughter. For the past 10 years, Hoa has been working hard to manage her general store, which sells basic family items and stationery. 

To help expand her business, Hoa requests a loan to purchase a greater quantity and variety of products to meet her customers' needs, such as beverages, sugar, milk and other special products for the coming holiday season. She hopes that the loan will help her to generate greater profits and to improve the quality of life for her family. Hoa hopes that in the future she will be able to improve the welfare of her children and continue to grow her business.

loans.use: to expand her business by buying a greater quantity and variety of products to stock her general store.

loans.name: Sau

texts.en:
Sau is 44 years old and is a married mother of two children. She lives with her husband and children in Ho Chi Minh City. Her and her husband run a small food stall in front of the door of her house. They sell foods like pork soup and noodles to people in their local community. They have been in this business for 8 years. The income from their business covers their children's education fees and basic family expenses.

Sau is seeking a loan to purchase foodstuffs to increase the variety of foods that she sells from her stall and also to buy new furniture for her food stall. This will allow her to increase her monthly profit and improve her family's life.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs to increase the variety of food she sells and new furniture for her food stall

loans.name: Then

texts.en:
Then is 35 years old and married. She has two daughters and lives with them and her husband in Ho Chi Minh city. Her husband is a truck driver and helps her to manage a general store.

Then runs a store at her house that sells many kinds of food, snacks, instant noodles, milk, fruit-juice bottles, and shampoo for the people in her community.

Then would like to take a loan to buy new products such as rice and beverages to sell to her customers. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to generate a higher income and save money to further expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new products such as rice and beverages to sell from her general store

loans.name: Adora

texts.en:
Adora is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 
Adora has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages .
Adora has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Adora hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Hieu

texts.en:
Hieu, 34, is married with one son. She lives with her child and husband in Ho Chi M. City. 

Hieu has been operating a small general store for nine years. She would like to take a loan and plans to use this loan to increase the quantity and range of products she sells, such as beverages, milk, sugar and confectioneries. She hopes this loan will help her to increase her income, improve her family's living conditions, and cover the cost of her son's education.

loans.use: to buy beverages, milk, sugar, and confectioneries to stock her general store.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. Evangeline has a shop that sells canned goods, shampoo, soaps, and detergents. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, shampoo, soaps, and beverages to sell. Evangeline has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Evangeline hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, shampoo, soaps, and beverages to sell

loans.name: Nhung

texts.en:
Nhung is a 39-year-old married woman with two children (one son and one daughter). She lives in Ho Chi Minh City.

Nhung runs a general store from her house. She began this business five years ago. Her husband also supports the family by working as a mechanic.

Nhung is requesting a loan to buy a greater range and quantity of products, such as basic foods, snacks and beverages to sell from her general store. 

She hopes that this will enable her to better serve her existing customers and attract new customers. She also hopes that through the loan she will be able to generate a higher income and set aside some savings for the future.

loans.use: to buy a greater range and quantity of products, such as basic foods, snacks and beverages to sell from her general store.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with eight children.

Helen has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Helen has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Helen hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.
 
Marivic makes and sells snacks like rice cakes and pancakes. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks.

Marivic has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Marivic hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks.

loans.name: Nhip

texts.en:
Nhip, 37, has been engaged in selling fruit and vegetables for over 14 years. She lives with three children (two sons and one daughter) and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works as a driver.

Nhip sells a variety of fruit and vegetables such as green pumpkins, bitter melons, cucumbers and bananas. Her business is able to generate sufficient income to cover her family's everyday expenses. 

Nhip would like to request a loan to improve her business by buying a larger quantity and variety of fruit and vegetables to sell. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to earn more income to support her family.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity and variety of fruit and vegetables to stock her store.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is a widow with five children. 

Evelyn has a shop that sells vegetables like string beans, bitter melon and cabbage. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy vegetables to sell.

Evelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Evelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Duyen

texts.en:
Duyen is a 44 years old. She lives with her husband and three children in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Duyen and her husband run a food stall from their house selling beef noodles to people in their community. They began this business 15 years ago.

She is requesting a loan to repair her stall and buy new furniture and good quality ingredients to make good soup. She hopes that this will enable her to better serve her existing customers and attract new customers. She also hopes that through the loan she will be able to generate more income and set aside some savings for the future.

loans.use: to buy new furniture and quality ingredients to make good soup.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung is a 43-year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City with her husband and four children. 

Dung earns income to support her family by operating a general store, which she has run for the past 20 years. Dung would like to take out a loan to expand her general store by purchasing a greater range and quantity of cosmetic products, beverages and miscellaneous items to serve a larger number of customers. 

She hopes that through the loan her business will be able to generate more income and enable her to improve her family's living conditions while putting aside savings for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products, beverages and miscellaneous items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Linh

texts.en:
Linh, 38, is a married woman with two daughters and one son. Her husband earns money running an Internet cafe. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

For nearly 13 years, Linh has supported her family with the income she earns from her general store that occupies the front of her house. She sells rice, beverages, sweets and cigarettes. She intends to take a loan to buy more food and beverages in bulk and to repair some billiard tables that will be placed in her husband's Internet cafe. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business and generate more income to help improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy food and beverages in bulk and repair some billiard tables.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong is 45-years-old and married with two children. She lives with her husband and children in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Huong and her husband have been running a food stall for ten years. They primarily sell beef noodles from their stall, which they sell to people in her community.

Huong would like to receive a loan to buy new furniture for her stall and to buy a greater quantity and quality of ingredients to make good food to sell. She hopes that this will enable her to attract new customers and increase the income that she earns from her business. She hopes that with the increased income she will be able to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy new furniture and food to sell from her food stall.

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Anh is a 47-year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has two children and she has been running a beverage store for 20 years. 

Anh would like to take loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of beverage to stock her store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of beverages to stock her store.

loans.name: Ninh

texts.en:
Ninh is a 51-year-old widowed woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has 1 son and 2 daughters. 

Two years ago, Ninh opened a soft drink store. She would like to take loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of beverages to stock her store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and will help her to save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of beverage to stock her store.

loans.name: Son

texts.en:
Son and his family live in Ho Chi Minh City. He is 50-years-old and has three children. 

Son has been earning a living by producing parts for polishing furniture for the past five years. Son would like to borrow money to buy more materials to expand his business and produce a larger quantity of parts. He hopes that this will enable him to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more materials to produce parts for polishing furniture.

loans.name: Tu

texts.en:
Tu is a 41-year-old married woman. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works as a labourer.

Tu has been running a general store in front of her house for fifteen years. She sells many kinds of snacks and candy to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of foods to stock her store and better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of foods to stock her general store.

loans.name: Ha

texts.en:
Ha is 33 years old and lives in Ho Chi Minh city. She is married and has two daughters. For the past seven years, Ha has been working hard to manage her clothing business, which sells women's garments and children's wear and some small accessories.

To help expand her business, Ha has requested a loan to purchase a greater quantity and variety of women's garments and children's wear to sell. She hopes that this will enable her to generate greater profits and to improve the quality of life for her family. She hopes that in the future she will be able to better provide for her children and continue to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase women's garments and children's wear.

loans.name: Shameem's Group

texts.en:
Shameem is 42 years old. She is married and has two children who are getting their education by attending local school. Her husband operates a grocery store through which he sells daily use items such as salt, sugar, etc. He also operates a livestock business from home & has some buffaloes whose milk he sells to his community customers.

Shameem is a housewife but in her spare time she also supports her husband in his grocery store and livestock businesses. She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. He will utilize the loan in his grocery store business by purchasing daily use items such as salt, sugar, spices, etc. He is very experienced in his job and Shameem is hopeful that his businesses will grow further after investment.

Note: - The lady holding a pass book in the picture is Shameem.

loans.use: to buy salt, sugar, spices and other grocery store items for resale.

loans.name: Diep

texts.en:
Diep is a 46-year-old married woman. She has one son and one daughter. She and her husband support their family by selling food in the local community from their food stall. 

Diep would like to take out a loan to buy a greater quantity and better quality of food and furniture to expand her business. She hopes that through the loan she can attract new customers and improve her family's living conditions with the higher income that she generates.

loans.use: to buy more food and furniture to expand her business.

loans.name: Diep

texts.en:
Diep is a 44-year-old married woman. She lives with her three sons and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money as a labourer in the construction field. She has operated a cafe in front of her house for one year.

Diep would like a loan to purchase a greater range and quantity of beverages to stock her store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

Diep also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase a greater range and quantity of beverages to stock her store.

loans.name: Ensherah

texts.en:
Ensherah is a 45-year-old married woman from Madaba, Jordan and a mother of eight children.

Ensherah is selling milk and other dairy products that she makes from her home and she is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase materials needed for her business .

Ensherah is looking to improve her business so that she can finance her daughter's education.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to make dairy products.

loans.name: Ngan

texts.en:
Ngan is a 43-year-old married woman. She lives with her family and two children in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works as a carpenter. 

Ngan has been running a food stall from the door of her house for the past year. She sells noodles. 

She would like to borrow money to expand her business by buying more furniture to seat her customers and a greater quantity and variety of food to sell from her stall. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers, increase her income, and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more furniture and food for her food stall

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Phan is 50 years old and married with one son. She and her husband earn money by selling food to the local community from their food stall. 

Phan would like to borrow a loan to buy more furniture for her stall and to buy a greater quantity and quality of food to sell from her stall. She hopes that through the loan she can generate a higher income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more furniture and food for her food stall

loans.name: Khaledieh

texts.en:
Khaledieh is a 41-years-old divorced woman from Madaba, Jordan.

Khaledieh does embroidery and she is working from her home and is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase a sewing machine so that she can improve her business.

Khaledieh is looking to improve her financiA. conditions since she is divorced.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong is a 46-year-old married woman with two daughters. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

For over ten years, Hong has been operating a general store selling basic household necessities and many kinds of instant food to people in her community. She would like to take a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of goods in bulk to stock her store. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and increase the turnover of her business.

Hong hopes that through her loan she will be able to improve her family's living conditions and set aside savings for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods and food for her general store

loans.name: Diep

texts.en:
Diep is a 35-year-old married woman with two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband supports the family by earning an income as a driver for hire. 

For four years, Diep has supported her family by selling lottery tickets in various locations. She would like a loan to expand her business as a lottery ticket vendor and to buy a larger quantity of lottery tickets to sell. In addition, she intends to buy a motorbike for her business, which will enable her to cover greater distances. 

Diep hopes that through the loan she will be able to increase her income and set aside some savings.

loans.use: to buy lottery tickets to sell and a motorbike for her business activities.

loans.name: Thoa

texts.en:
Thoa is a 43-year old married mother of two children. She lives with her husband and children in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money by making iron doors. She runs a small general store selling food products and household necessities in their community. She has been in this business for over three years. 

Thoa would like to take loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods to stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan, her business will generate a higher income. This will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money for her family.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods to stock her general store.

loans.name: Bi

texts.en:
Bi is a 65-year-old widowed woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has three children. She has owned a general store for over three years. 

Bi would like to take out a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as foods, beverages, detergents, soaps, and shampoos to stock her store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and increase the turnover of her business. 

She also hopes that through the loan, her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as foods, beverages, detergents, soaps, and shampoos to stock her store.

loans.name: Trang

texts.en:
Trang is a 33-year-old married mother of two children. Her husband is a mechanical worker. She earns a living running a general store. She started this business three years ago. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City.

Trang would like to take out a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as fruit, eggs, sugar, soft drinks, soap, shampoo, and toiletries to stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income, which will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as fruit, eggs, sugar, soft drinks, soap, shampoo, and toiletries to stock her general store.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is 46 years old and is a married woman with three children. Her husband works as a security guard and helps her to run a general store in front of their house. Hoa started this business two years ago and uses the income from this business to cover family expenses and raise her children. Hoa and her family live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Hoa is requesting a loan to purchase rice and a variety of foods and seasonal goods in bulk to sell during the coming holiday season. She hopes that by offering a greater variety of products, she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. 

She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand this business and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase rice, other foods and seasonal goods in bulk to sell during the holiday season.

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan is 33 years old. She lives with her husband and three children in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Loan has managed her general store for over five years. Her husband helps her to deliver goods when they are ordered. Loan sells many kinds of beverages and basic household items. She intends to take a loan to buy a greater quantity and variety of goods in bulk to sell to her customers during the coming holiday season.

She hopes that through the loan she can earn more money and can save enough money to send her children to school.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity and variety of goods in bulk to sell from her general store.

loans.name: Thi

texts.en:
T. is a 37-year-old married woman with a daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband makes money by sewing bags and backpacks. T. supports her family by owning a beauty salon at her house. She started this business eleven years ago.
  
T. would like a loan to buy new hairdressing tools and cosmetic products to sell in her salon to better meet her customers' needs. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to increase her income and set aside some savings.

loans.use: To buy new hairdressing tools and cosmetic products to sell in her salon.

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en:
Sabah is a 40-year-old woman from Baqa'a, Jordan and a mother of four children. 

Sabah makes accessories from her home and she is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase materials needed for her business such as beads.

Sabah is looking to expand her business by adding more lines such as doing embroidery so that she can increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed for making accessories.

loans.name: Patriciah

texts.en: Patriciah previously obtained a loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings, which she used to buy a gearbox for the car she uses for her taxi business. Patriciah has been able to open a grocery business in addition to her taxi business and her retail shop. She now wants to stock fruits and vegetables in her grocery. Therefore, she has requested 78,000 Kenyan shillings to buy bananas, oranges, cabbages, and kale.

loans.use: to buy bananas, oranges, cabbages and kale.

loans.name: Tham

texts.en:
Tham, 41, is married and earns a living to support her family by running a general store. She lives with her two children and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Tham has been running a general store from her home for three years. Tham would now like to take out a loan to expand her business. With the loan, she intends to repair her home and store and buy products in bulk, such as food and basic goods to sell from her store. She hopes that this will improve the living conditions of her family and generate more income from her business. She also hopes that this will enable her to save money for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to repair her home and store and buy foods and basic goods in bulk to sell from her store.
